Apare pana idāni byañjanāni antokammavācāya
analyzed: dīghe vattabbe rassam rasse vattabbe dīgham vadati tathā garuke vattabbe lahukam  lahuke vattabbe garukam vadati sambandhe vā vattabbe vavatthitam vavatthite vā  vattabbe sambandham vadati evam pi kamma vācā na kuppati imāni cha byañjanāni kammaṃ  na kopenti idam eva ācariyānam samāna kathā apare pana idāni byañjanāni antokamma vācāya
translated: if he says what should be said in full in brief, or what should be said in brief in full, or what should be said in a grave manner in a light manner,

original: kammaṃ dūsentīti vadanti, evaṃ sati anupasampannāva bahutarā bhaveyyuṃ, vīmaṃsitvā

If that were so, then there would be more unaccepted proclamations than accepted ones. But it should be understood that🔽the proclamation is invalidated by the faults mentioned above.

original: pana gahetabbaṃ. Suṭṭhutarā vā kammavācā sikkhitabbā. Sāvanāya anokāse paṭhamaṃ ñattiṃ🔽aṭṭhapetvā anusāvanaṃ akāle sāvanaṃ nāma. Iti imehi dosehi vimuttāya anusāvanāya
analyzed: pana gahetabbam suṭṭhutarā vā kamma vācā sikkhitabbā sāvanāya anokāse paṭhamam ñattim 🔽aṭṭhapetvā anusāvanam akāle sāvanam nāma iti imehi dosehi vimuttāya anusāvanāya
translated: Or else the proclamation should be learned more thoroughly. The proclamation is untimely if the first motion is made at the wrong time. Thus the proclamation is invalidated by these faults.

analyzed: sampannam anusāvana sampatti sampannam nāma yadi patta cīvara rahitam puggalam upasampādeti  paripuṇṇassa patta cīvaranti anusāvanāya kata ttā kamma kopaḥ na hoti kāraka saṅgho  pana sa atisāraḥ tena iva āha patta cīvarānaṃ abhāve pi paripuṇṇassa
translated: If he gives the full admission to a person who is without bowl and robes,🔽then because the motion is made, “The bowl and robes are complete for the one who is complete,” there is no offence for the action. analyzed: katham tvam sakkuṇeyyā asi sabbaññu jina gocare
translated: How can you, in the province of the Omniscient One,

analyzed: iti me upavadeyyum dharatā iva mahā muni
translated: The Great Sage will bear with me, though they should say to him:🔽“The great tree of the Pali language,

translated: The meaning is: “I will make a treatise.” Herein, “boundary” means the fifteen kinds of boundaries. What are the fifteen?

original: Khaṇḍasīmā, upacārasīmā, samānasaṃvāsasīmā, avippavāsasīmā, lābhasīmā, gāmasīmā,🔽nigamasīmā, nagarasīmā, abbhantarasīmā, udakukkhepasīmā, janapadasīmā, raṭṭhasīmā,
analyzed: khaṇḍa sīmā upacāra sīmā samāna saṃvāsa sīmā avippavāsa sīmā lābha sīmā gāma sīmā  nigama sīmā nagara sīmā abbhantara sīmā udakukkhepa sīmā janapada sīmā raṭṭha sīmā
translated: The “broken boundary,” the “boundary of access,” the “boundary of common affiliation,” the “boundary of no disaffiliation,” the “boundary of gain,” the “boundary of a village,”🔽the “boundary of a town,” the “boundary of a city,” the “internal boundary,” the “boundary of a water-throwing” , the “boundary of a country,” the “boundary of a province,”

original: rajjasīmā, dīpasīmā, cakkavāḷasīmā’ti. Tattha khaṇḍasīmā nāma pabbajjupasampadādīnaṃ
analyzed: rajja sīmā dīpa sīmā cakkavāḷa sīmā ti tattha khaṇḍa sīmā nāma pabbajja upasampad ādīnam
translated: the “boundary of a kingdom,” the “boundary of an island,” the “boundary of an ocean-bound continent” .

original: saṅghakammānaṃ sukhakaraṇatthaṃ mahāsīmāya vā gāmakhette vā khaṇḍitvā paricchinditvā🔽sammatā. Tassāvitthāro ''paṭhamaṃ nimittā kittetabbā''ti ādinā dvāsattatippabhedāya
analyzed: saṅgha kammānam sukha karaṇa attham mahā sīmāya vā gāma khette vā khaṇḍitvā paricchinditvā  paṭhamam nimittā ādinā dvāsattati pabhedāya
translated: Herein, the “broken boundary” is that which is agreed upon by the Order for the purpose of making it easy to do the legal acts of the Order such as admission and ordination, by breaking up and defining the great earth or a field belonging to a village.🔽The detailed explanation of it is given in the Great Book of the Vinaya Commentary in the section on the “All-round Lovely” in the explanation of the seventy-two kinds beginning with “First the sign is to be announced” .

original: samantapāsādikāya vinayaṭṭhakathāya mahāvagge vutto, idha vuttopi tatheva vutto bhaveyya,
analyzed: samantapāsādikāya vinaya ṭṭhakathāya mahā vagge vuttaḥ idha vuttaḥ api tathā iva vuttaḥ bhaveyya
translated: If it is given here it would be as if given there,

original: tasmā na vakkhāma, duviññeyyaṭṭhānameva kiñciṭhānaṃ nīharitvā pākaṭaṃ karissāma.
analyzed: tasmā na vakkhāma du viññeyya ṭṭhānam eva kiñci ṭhānam nīharitvā pākaṭam karissāma
translated: so we shall not give it. We shall only take out and make clear some point that is difficult to understand.

original: Tattha sace pana heṭṭhā uparimassa sīmāparicchedassa parato anto leṇaṃ hoti, bahi
analyzed: tattha sace pana heṭṭhā uparimassa sīmā paricchedassa paratas antar leṇam hoti bahi
translated: Herein, if there is a cave inside the area defined as the upper boundary beyond the lower boundary, outside the lower boundary,

original: sīmā na otarati. Athāpi uparimassa sīmāparicchedassa orato bahi leṇaṃ hoti, antosīmā
analyzed: sīmā na otarati atha api uparimassa sīmā paricchedassa oratas bahi leṇam hoti antosīmā
translated: and it does not enter the territory. But if there is a cave outside the near side of the upper boundary,

original: na otaratīti ime dve ekatthā byañjanameva nānaṃ. Ayañhetthatthouparimassa sīmāparicchedassa
analyzed: na otarati iti ime dve ekatthā byañjanam eva sīmā paricchedassa
translated: and it does not enter the territory, these two are the same in meaning, only the wording is different. This is the meaning here:

original: orimabhāgato heṭṭhā pabbatapāde umaṅgasaṇṭhānena pabbatapasse vijjhitvā leṇaṃ hoti,🔽sīmāparicchedassa parato leṇe ca leṇassa bahibhūte heṭṭhā pabbate ca bhūmibhāge sīmā🔽na otarati, leṇassa upariyeva sīmā hotīti. Tassa uparimassa sīmāparicchedassa orimabhāgato
analyzed: orima bhāgataḥ heṭṭhā pabbata pāde umaṅga saṇṭhānena pabbata passe vijjhitvā leṇam hoti  sīmā paricchedassa paratas leṇe ca leṇassa bahibhūte heṭṭhā pabbate ca bhūmi bhāge sīmā  na otarati leṇassa upariyā iva sīmā hoti iti tassa uparimassa sīmā paricchedassa orima bhāgato
translated: if there is a cave on the side of a mountain, having been pierced by a fissure in the shape of a ploughshare below the near side of the upper boundary,🔽and the territory does not enter the cave and the ground below the mountain outside the cave and outside the territory,

original: bahibhūte heṭṭhā pabbatapāde umaṅgasaṇṭhānena vijjhitvā pabbatapasse leṇaṃ athāpi
analyzed: bahibhūte heṭṭhā pabbata pāde umaṅga saṇṭhānena vijjhitvā pabbata passe leṇam atha api
translated: the territory is only above the cave. If there is a cave on the side of a mountain, having been pierced by a fissure in the shape of a ploughshare below the ground outside the near side of the upper boundary,

original: hoti, leṇe ca leṇassa parabhūte heṭṭhā pabbate ca bhūmibhāge sīmā na otarati, leṇassa
analyzed: hoti leṇe ca leṇassa parabhūte heṭṭhā pabbate ca bhūmi bhāge sīmā na otarati leṇassa
translated: and the territory does not enter the cave and the ground below the mountain outside the cave, the territory is only

original: uparibhāge va sīmā hotīti. Esā ca vicāraṇā vimativinodaniyampi katā. Anto ti pabbatassa
analyzed: upari bhāge sīmā hoti iti esā ca vicāraṇā vimati vinodaniyam pi katā antaḥ ti pabbatassa
translated: above the cave. This discussion is also given in the Vimativinodani. Inside means inside the mountain.

original: anto, pabbatamūleti attho. Tameva antosaddaṃ sīmāparicchedena visesetuṃ “uparimassa🔽sīmāparicchedassa parato”ti vuttaṃ. Pabbatapādaṃ pana apekkhitvā “orato”ti vattabbepi
analyzed: antar pabbata mūle ti attho tam eva antar saddam sīmā paricchedena visesetum uparimassa  sīmā paricchedassa paratas ti vuttam pabbata pādam pana apekkhitvā oratas ti vattabbe pi
translated: The meaning is: inside, at the foot of the mountain. In order to specify that very word “inside” by means of the boundary line, it is said: “beyond the upper boundary line.”🔽But although it should be said: “near the mountain,”

original: sīmānissayaṃ pabbataggaṃ sandhāya “parato”ti vuttanti daṭṭhabbaṃ teneva bahileṇanti
analyzed: sīmānissayam pabbata aggam sandhāya paratas ti vuttan ti daṭṭhabbam tena iva bahi leṇam ti
translated: it should be understood that it is said: “beyond” with reference to the mountain peak which is the support for the boundary.🔽Therefore, in the expression: “outside the cave,”

original: ettha bahisaddaṃ visesento “uparimassa sīmāparicchedassa orato”ti āha. Bahi sīmā🔽na otaratīti ettha bahī ti pabbatapādeleṇaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Leṇassa bahibhūte upari
analyzed: ettha bahi saddam visesento uparimassa sīmā paricchedassa orataḥ ti āha bahi sīmā  na otarati iti ettha bahi ti pabbata pāda leṇam sandhāya vuttam leṇassa bahi bhūte upari
translated: he specifies the word “outside” by saying: “near the upper boundary line.”🔽The meaning is: the boundary does not enter the outside of the cave.🔽In the expression: “the boundary does not enter the outside of the boundary,”

original: sīmāparicchedassa heṭṭhābhāge sīmā na otaratīti attho. Antosīmāti leṇassa ca pabbatapādassa
analyzed: sīmā paricchedassa heṭṭhā bhāge sīmā na otarati iti attho antosīmā ati leṇassa ca pabbata pādassa
translated: the word “outside” refers to the mountain slope. The meaning is: the boundary does not enter the lower part of the upper boundary line which is outside the cave.🔽The meaning is: the boundary does not enter the inside of the cave and the foot of the mountain, in the place suitable for its own entry.

original: ca anto attano otaraṇārahaṭṭhāne na otaratīti attho. Bahi sīmā na otaratīti attho,
analyzed: ca antar attanaḥ otaraṇa raha ṭṭhāne na otarati iti attho bahi sīmā na otarati iti attho
translated: The meaning is: the boundary does not enter the outside of the boundary.

original: sīmā na otaratī ti cettha attano otaraṇārahaṭṭhāne leṇabhāvena sīmā sabbathā “anotaraṇameva
analyzed: sīmā naḥ otarati ti ca ittha attanaḥ otaraṇa araha ṭṭhāne leṇa bhāvena sīmā sabbathā anotaraṇam eva
translated: The meaning is: the boundary does not enter the cave in every way, in the place suitable for its own entry.

original: dassitanti gahetabbaṃ. Tattha pi anotaraṇanti uparieva sīmā hotī”ti vimativinodanī.
analyzed: dassitanti gahetabbam tattha pi upari eva sīmā hoti iti vimati vinodanī
translated: “The boundary is to be taken as the place where the water is seen to be cut off. There is no crossing over there.”

original: Keci pana veḷususiro viya susirameva leṇanti vadanti, taṃ ayuttaṃ.
analyzed: keci pana veḷu susiraḥ viya susiram eva vadanti tat ayuttam
translated: But some say that the “cave” is like a bamboo joint, open all round. That is incorrect.

original: Upacārasīmā nāma gāmāraññanigamādivasā yāva brahmalokā tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ nivāsagehassa
analyzed: upacārasīmāḥ nāma gāma arañña nigama ādivasāḥ yāva brahmalokā tesam tesam sattānam nivāsa gehassa
translated: The “conventional boundary” is the place of resort for the various beings, from the world of the gods down to the world of Brahmā, for their dwelling houses,

original: vā devavimānakapparukkhādīnaṃ vā upacārārahaṭṭhānameva upacārasīmā te idha nādhippetā,🔽bhikkhūnaṃ avisayatāya. Yaṃ pana padesaṃ paricchinditvā pariveṇaṃ katvā pākārādiparikkhittaṃ🔽vā katvā aparikkhittepi upacārārahaṭṭhānaṃ paricchinditvā vā yasmiṃ padese bhikkhū
analyzed: vā deva vimāna kappa rukkha ādīnam vā upacāra araha ṭṭhānam eva upacāra sīmā te idha na adhippetā  bhikkhūnam avisaya tāya yam pana padesam paricchinditvā pariveṇam katvā pākāra ādi parikkhittam  vā katvā a parikkhitte api upacāra araha ṭṭhānam paricchinditvā vā yasmin padese bhikkhū
translated: or for the divine palaces, wish-fulfilling trees, etc., according to the case. But that is not intended here;🔽for it is not the province of bhikkhus. But the “conventional boundary” intended here is that place which is enclosed by a fence or a wall,🔽or which is defined by a boundary line, and where bhikkhus

original: vasanti, ayameva upacārasīmāti adhippetā. Bhikkhūnaṃ vassūpagamanakathinatthārakaraṇaṭṭhānattā,
analyzed: vasanti ayam eva upacāra sīmā ti adhippetā bhikkhūnam
translated: dwell. It is so called because it is the place where bhikkhus enter upon the rains and make kathina cloth.

original: tathā hi “kathinatthatasīmāya”nti upacārasīmaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ, khandhasīmāya tatruppādābhāvatoti
analyzed: tathā hi upacāra sīmam sandhāya vuttam khandha sīmāya tatra uppāda abhāvato ti
translated: For it is said with reference to the conventional boundary that “the boundary is the place where the kathina is made” . But in the case of a khandha-sīmā, the making of kathina cloth does not come into it.

original: tīsupi gaṇṭhipadesu vuttaṃ. Tatruppādenā bhatanti vihārasantakena khettavatthuādinā🔽ābhataṃ kiñci saṅghikaṃ cīvaraṃ uppajjati, taṃ tesaṃ kathinatthārakabhikkhūnaṃ yeva
analyzed: tīsu pi gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam vihāra santakena khetta vatthu ādinā  ābhatam kiñci saṅghikam cīvaram uppajjati tam tesam kathinatthāraka bhikkhūnam yeva
translated: And this is said in all three passages. “By that which is obtained”: any robe belonging to the Community that is obtained by means of a field, a building site, etc.,

original: bhavissatīti yojanā kātabbā. Khettavatthuādinā ti ettha ādisaddena matakacīvaraṃ
analyzed: bhavissati iti yojanā kātabbā khetta vatthu ādinā ti ettha ādi saddena mataka cīvaram
translated: will be for those monks who are keeping the kaṭhina. This is how it should be construed. “By means of a field, a building site, etc.”: the word “etc.” in the text includes a robe belonging to a dead person

original: vā hotu saṃghaṃ uddissa dinnaṃ vā saṅghikena vā ti mahāaṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttaṃ. Tasmiṃ
analyzed: vā hotu saṃgham uddissa dinnam vā saṅghikena vā ti mahā aṭṭhakathāyam vuttam tasmin
translated: or a robe given in dedication to the Community or a robe belonging to the Community.

original: upacārasīme pavattacīvaraṃ sabbaṃ saṅgaṇhāti, teneva “tena kho pana samayena aññatarena🔽upāsakena saṅghaṃ uddissa vihāro kārito hoti, so tassa vihārassa kate ubhatosaṅghassa
analyzed: upacāra sīme pavatta cīvaram sabbam saṅgaṇhāti tena iva tena kho pana samayena aññatarena  upāsakena saṅgham uddissa vihāraḥ kāritaḥ hoti saḥ tassa vihārassa kate ubhatosaṅghassa
translated: It includes all robes that are obtained within the vicinity of the monastery.🔽“On one occasion a certain lay follower had a dwelling built for the Community. When the dwelling was finished, he wanted to give out-of-season robe-cloth to both Sanghas.

original: akālacīvaraṃ dātukāmo hoti. Tena kho pana samayena ubhatosaṅghassa kathinaṃ atthataṃ
analyzed: akāla cīvaram dātu kāmo hoti tena kho pana samayena ubhato saṅghassa kathinam
translated: On that occasion the kaṭhina had already been spread for both Sanghas.

original: hoti. Atha kho so upāsako saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā kathinuddhāraṃ yācī”ti imasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ
analyzed: hoti atha kho saḥ upāsakaḥ saṅgham upasaṅkamitvā kathin uddhāram yāci iti imasmin vatthusmin
translated: Then that lay follower went to the Community and asked for the kaṭhina to be removed.”

original: ānisaṃsapasambhanatthaṃ kathinuddhāraṃ bhagavatā paññattaṃ, teneva thullanandā bhikkhunī
analyzed: ānisaṃsa pasambhana attham kathin uddhāram bhagavatā paññattam tena iva thullanandā bhikkhunī
translated: The Blessed One laid down the ending of the robe-making season for the purpose of the benefits.

original: ānisaṃsaṃ appaṭippassambhentā cīvaraṃ amhākaṃ bhavissatīti kathinuddhāraṃ paṭibāhi,
analyzed: ānisaṃsam appaṭippassambhentā cīvaram amhākam bhavissati iti kathin uddhāram paṭibāhi
translated: Then the nun Thullanandā, not having settled the benefits, prevented the ending of the robe-making season, thinking, “The robe will be ours.”

original: tasmā kathinatthatasīmāyaṃ anuddhaṭe kathine yāva phagguṇapuṇṇamā pañca māsā etthantare🔽matakacīvaraṃ vā hotu cātuddisaṃ saṅghaṃ uddissa matānaṃ ñātijanānaṃ vā, bhikkhāpaññattiyā🔽vā vihāramahādikiccena vā yenakenaci ākārena saṅghikaṃ cīvaraṃ dinnaṃ hoti, taṃ sabbaṃ
analyzed: an uddhaṭe kathine yāva phagguṇa puṇṇamā pañca māsāḥ etthantare  mataka cīvaram vā hotu cātuddisam saṅgham uddissa matānam ñāti janānam vā bhikkhā paññattiyā  vā vihāra mahā ādi kiccena vā yena kenacid ākārena saṅghikam cīvaram dinnam hoti tam sabbam
translated: Therefore, when the robe-making season has not been ended in the monastery zone of the robe-making ceremony, for five months, until the full moon of Phagguna,🔽whether it is a robe for the dead, given to the Sangha of the four directions, or to the relatives of the dead, or whether it is a robe given in any way as a gift of alms,🔽or for the great work of a monastery, all that

original: tesaṃ kathinatthārakabhikkhūnaṃyeva hoti. Chinnavassānaṃ vā pacchimikāya upagatānaṃ
analyzed: tesam kathinatthāraka bhikkhūnam yeva hoti chinna vassānam vā pacchimikāya upagatānam
translated: belongs only to the monks who are ending the robe-making season. It does not belong to the monks who have completed the rainy season residence and have left,

original: vā tattha sampattānaṃ sīmaṭṭhakabhikkhūnaṃ vā na hoti. Ajānitvā ce gaṇhanti dātabbameva.
analyzed: vā tattha sampattānam sīmaṭṭhaka bhikkhūnam vā na hoti a jānitvā ce gaṇhanti dātabbam eva
translated: or to the monks who have arrived there and are staying within the monastery zone. If they take it without knowing, it should be given to them.

original: Yadi taṃ cīvaraṃ taṇḍulādikhādanīyabhojanaṃ karoti, itaresampi hotiyeva. Kasmāti
analyzed: yadi tam cīvaram taṇḍula ādi khādanīya bhojanam karoti itaresam pi kasmāt iti
translated: If that robe is made into rice or other food, it belongs to the others too. Why is that?

original: ce ānisaṃsa vigatattā. Teneva gaṇapūraṇavasena sampattānaṃ chinnaṃ vassānaṃ vā pacchimikāya
analyzed: ce tena iva gaṇa pūraṇa vasena sampattānam chinnam vassānam vā pacchimikāya
translated: and because of the benefits. So if they have completed the Rains and have not yet cut their rains-cloth,🔽or if they have entered for the last month,

original: upagatānaṃ vā aññasmiṃ vihāre vutthavassanaṃ vā khādanīyabhojanīyādīni pāpuṇanti.
analyzed: upagatānam vā aññasmim vihāre vuttha vassanam vā khādanīya bhojanīya ādīni pāpuṇanti
translated: or if they have completed the Rains in another monastery, they will get the fresh foods, etc.

original: Kathinatthatasāṭakassa dānakammavācā pana khaṇḍasīmāyameva vaṭṭasi. Tasmiṃ vihāre
analyzed: dāna kamma vācā pana khaṇḍa sīmāyam eva vaṭṭasi tasmin vihāre
translated: But the announcement of the giving of the robe-cloth for the making of the kathina is allowable only within the zone of the same meeting. If there is no monastery

original: asati aññavihāre baddhasīmāya vā udakukkhepasīmādīsu vā kātabbameva.
analyzed: asati añña vihāre baddha sīmāya vā udakukkhepa sīmā ādīsu vā kātabbam eva
translated: in that place, it should be done in another monastery with a defined zone, or in a zone defined by throwing water, and so on.

original: Kasmāti ce, tasmiṃ vihāre purimikāya upagatā kathinatthārakusalā na honti. Atthārakusalā
analyzed: kasmāti ce tasmin vihāre purimikāya upagatā na honti atthāra kusalā
translated: Why? Because those who have entered for the first period in that monastery are not skilled in the making of the kathina. Skilled in the making of the kathina,

original: khandhakabhāṇakattherā pariyesitvā ānetabbā. Kammavācaṃ sāvetvā kathinaṃ attharāpetvā
analyzed: khandhaka bhāṇaka therā pariyesitvā ānetabbā kamma vācam sāvetvā kathinam attharāpetvā
translated: the Elder Dhammakathika of the Khandhaka, should be sought out and brought. After the announcement of the transaction has been made and the kathina has been made to be spread,

original: dānañca bhuñjitvā gamissanti, ānisaṃso pana itaresaṃ vahotī’ti. Aññasīmaṭṭhakabhikkhūnampi
analyzed: dānañca bhuñjitvā gamissanti ānisaṃso pana itaresam vahoti iti añña sīmaṭṭhaka bhikkhūnam pi
translated: they will eat the gift and then go. But the benefits accrue to the others. ’🔽Because the announcement of the transaction is stated in the commentary for bhikkhus who are in another zone. Those who have completed the Rains and have entered for the last month,

original: kammavāca sāvanassa aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttattā. Chinnavassāvā pacchimikāya upagatā vā
analyzed: sāvanassa aṭṭhakathāyam vutta ttā chinna vassāvā pacchimikāya upagatā vā
translated: because it is stated in the commentary to the Kammavācā.🔽Those who have completed the rains residence may undertake the observance-day ceremony on the fourteenth or fifteenth day of the lunar half-month.

original: aññasmiṃ vihāre vutthavassāpi vā purimikāya upagatānaṃ gaṇapūraṇamattameva labhanti,
analyzed: aññasmim vihāre vā purimikāya upagatānam gaṇa pūraṇa mattam eva labhanti
translated: Or if they have kept the rains in another monastery and have come to the first-arrival residence, they get only the filling up of the quorum;

original: ānisaṃso itaresaṃyeva hoti. Sacepi te chinnavassādayo anumodenti, bhinno kathinatthāro,🔽idaṃ aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vicāritaṃ. Apare pana “kathinatthatasīmanti upacārasīmaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: ānisaṃsaḥ itaresam yā iva hoti sace pi te chinna vassa ādayaḥ anumodenti bhinnaḥ kathinatthāraḥ  idam aṭṭhakathā ayam vicāritam apare pana upacāra sīmam sandhāya
translated: the benefit is only for the others. Even if those who have broken the rains, etc., rejoice in it, the robe-making ceremony is broken.🔽This is the discussion in the commentary. But others say that since it is said that “the robe-making ceremony zone” refers to the conventional zone,

original: vutta”nti vuttattā upacārasīmāyameva kathinanatthāraka ñattiṃ karonti, taṃ ayuttaṃ,🔽sodhetuṃ dukkarattā. Tathā hi upacārasīmāyameva paviṭṭhagāmasīmāyaṃ tattha otiṇṇe
analyzed: vuttam ti vutta ttā upacāra sīmāyam eva ñattim karonti tam ayuttam  sodhetum dukkara ttā tathā hi upacāra sīmāyam eva paviṭṭha gāma sīmāyam tattha otiṇṇe
translated: they make the motion for the robe-making ceremony only in the conventional zone. That is incorrect,🔽because it is difficult to purify. For who would be able to have the resident monks brought out or to make a zone outside the zone of the village that has entered the conventional zone?

original: bhikkhū tattha pāsānayanaṃ vā bahisīmakaraṇaṃ vā ko sakkhissati. “Kathinatthatasīmāya”nti
analyzed: bhikkhū tattha pāsā nayanam vā bahi sīmakaraṇam vā kaḥ sakkhissati
translated: And by the phrase “in the robe-making ceremony zone”

original: imināpipadena kathinatthatabhāvoyeva vutto, na kathinatthatasāṭakassa dānakammavācā,
analyzed: iminā api padena vuttaḥ na dāna kamma vācā
translated: only the state of having a robe-making ceremony is referred to, not the announcement of the giving of the robe-making cloth.

original: sā ca vicāraṇā kammacatukkena dīpetabbā. Tattha apalokanakammaṃ ñattikammaṃ ñattidutiyakammaṃ
analyzed: sā ca vicāraṇā kamma catukkena dīpetabbā tattha apalokana kammam ñatti kammam ñatti dutiya kammam
translated: And that discussion should be illuminated by the fourfold procedure. Herein, the act of informing is the motion. The act of informing and the act of one motion and one announcement

original: ñatticatutthakammanti. Tattha apalokanakammaṃ nāma sīmaṭṭhakasaṅghaṃ sodhetvā chandārahānaṃ🔽chandaṃ āharitvā samaggassa saṅghassa anumatiyā saṅghaṃ kittetvā “ruccati saṅghassā”ti
analyzed: ñatti catuttha kamman ti tattha apalokana kammam nāma sīmaṭṭhaka saṅgham sodhetvā chandāra hānam  chandam āharitvā samaggassa saṅghassa anumatiyā saṅgham kittetvā ruccati saṅghassa ati
translated: The four kinds of legal procedures: the legal procedure consisting of getting permission, the legal procedure consisting of one motion, the legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement, and the legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements.

original: tikkhuttuṃ anusāvetvā kattabbaṃ vuccati. Ñattikammaṃ nāma vuttanayeneva samaggassa🔽saṅghassa anumatiyā ekāya ñattiyā kattabbaṃ kammaṃ. Ñattidutiyakammaṃ nāma vuttanayeneva
analyzed: tikkhuttum anusāvetvā kattabbam vuccati ñatti kammam nāma vutta nayena iva samaggassa  saṅghassa anumatiyā ekāya ñattiyā kattabbam kammam ñattidutiyakammaṃ nāma vutta nayena iva
translated: Herein, the legal procedure consisting of getting permission is said to be done after the Sangha that is present in the monastery has been purified, the consent of those who are present and entitled to vote has been brought, the Sangha has been informed with the view to getting permission, and the announcement “Those who agree to the motion that … are to remain silent. Those who do not agree are to speak up” has been made three times.🔽The legal procedure consisting of one motion is said to be done with the consent of the Sangha that is present and unanimous, by means of one motion.

original: samaggassa saṅghassa anumatiyā ekāya ñattiyā ekāya ca anusāvanāyāti evaṃ ñattidutiyāya🔽anusāvanāya kattabbaṃ kammaṃ. Ñatticatutthakammaṃ nāma vuttanayeneva samaggassa saṅghassa
analyzed: samaggassa saṅghassa anumatiyā ekāya ñattiyā ekāya ca anusāvanāya ati evam ñatti dutiyāya  anusāvanāya kattabbam kammam ñatticatutthakammaṃ nāma vutta nayena iva samaggassa saṅghassa
translated: The legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement is said to be done with the consent of the Sangha that is present and unanimous, by means of one motion and one announcement.

original: anumatiyā ekāya ñattiyā tīhi ca anusāvanāhīti evaṃ ñatticatutthāhi tīhi anusāvanāhi
analyzed: anumatiyā ekāya ñattiyā tīhi ca anusāvanāhi iti evam ñatti catutthāhi tīhi anusāvanāhi
translated: The legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements is said to be done with the consent of the Sangha that is present and unanimous, by means of one motion and three announcements.

original: kattabbaṃ kammaṃ. Tattha apalokanakammaṃ phalabhājanakālādīsu lahukakammeyeva labbhati.
analyzed: kattabbam kammam tattha apalokana kammam phala bhājana kāla ādīsu lahuka kammā iya iva labbhati
translated: Herein, the legal procedure consisting of getting permission is only for light legal procedures, such as at the time of the distribution of fruits.

original: Kathinatthatasāṭakadānepi anatthateyeva kathine tato bahuānisaṃsacīvarasāṭakaṃ labhitvā
analyzed: kathinatthata sāṭaka dāne pi kathine tatas labhitvā
translated: And in the case of the giving of a cloth for the robe-making ceremony, if the robe-making ceremony has not been performed, then, having received a cloth for the robe-making ceremony with many advantages,

original: teneva sāṭakena attharitabbā, puna kammavācāya dānakiccaṃ natthi apalokanakammena🔽saṅghassa anumatiyā dātabbaṃ. Kathinatthatasāṭakadānakammavācā ekā ce vaṭṭati. Puna
analyzed: tena iva sāṭakena attharitabbā puna kamma vācāya dāna kiccam na atthi apalokana kammena  saṅghassa anumatiyā dātabbam ekā ce vaṭṭati puna
translated: he should perform the robe-making ceremony with that very cloth. There is no need for a further action in the form of a motion.🔽It should be given with the approval of the Sangha by means of the action of asking for approval.🔽The action in the form of a motion for the giving of a cloth for the robe-making ceremony is valid even if done by one. There is no need for a further action in the form of a motion.

original: kamma vācāyakiccaṃ natthi. Ñattikammaṃ pana dhammasaṅgāhakakāle mahākassapattherādīhi
analyzed: kamma vācāya kiccam na atthi ñatti kammam pana dhamma saṅgāhaka kāle mahākassapa tthera ādīhi
translated: But the action in the form of a motion is allowable only in the case of the collecting of the Dhamma, when the Elder Kassapa the Great and the others

original: attanāva attānaṃ sammannanakāle lahukakammeyeva labbhati. Ñattidutiyakammaṃ pana
analyzed: attanāva attānam sammannana kāle lahuka kammā iya iva labbhati ñatti dutiya kammam pana
translated: themselves gave their approval, and in the case of the simple action. But the action in the form of a motion and a proclamation is allowable

original: sīmāsammuti, sīmāsamūhanaṃ, kathinadānaṃ, kathinuddhāro, kuṭivatthudesanā, vihāravatthudesanāti
analyzed: sīmā sammuti sīmā samūhanam kathina dānam kathin uddhāraḥ kuṭi vatthu desanā vihāra vatthu desanā ati
translated: in the case of the six heavy actions, namely, the determination of a monastery zone, the lifting of a determination of a monastery zone, the giving of the robe-making material, the ending of the robe-making season, the assigning of a site for a building, and the assigning of a site for a building for the Sangha.

original: imāni cha garukammāni apaloketvā kātuṃ na vaṭṭati. Ñattidutiyakammavācaṃ sāvetvāva
analyzed: imāni cha garu kammāni apaloketvā kātum na vaṭṭati ñatti dutiya kamma vācam sāvetvā ava
translated: It is not allowable to do these without asking for approval. The action in the form of a motion and a proclamation

original: kātabbaṃ. Ito paresu cīvaravippavāsasammutiādīsu ñattidutiyakammesu apaloketvāpi
analyzed: kātabbam itas paresu cīvara vippavāsa sammuti ādīsu ñatti dutiya kammesu apaloketvā api
translated: should be done after proclaiming the motion. But in the other actions in the form of a motion and a proclamation, namely, the approval for absence during the robe-making ceremony, and so on,

original: kātabbaṃ, lahukakammattā. Ñatticatutthakammaṃ pana idāni upasampadākammaṃ idāni cattāri🔽kammāni baddhasīmāya vā, tasmiṃ asati udakukkhepasīmāya vā sodhetuṃ asakkonte sati
analyzed: kātabbam lahuka kamma ttā ñatti catuttha kammam pana idāni upasampadā kammam idāni cattāri  kammāni baddha sīmāya vā tasmin asati udakukkhepa sīmāya vā sodhetum a sakkonte sati
translated: The transaction of the full ordination is the fourth transaction.🔽The four transactions should be done in a monastery that has a defined territory, or if that is not possible, in one that has a defined area by throwing water, or if that is not possible, in one that has an undefined territory.

original: abaddhasīmāya vā kātabbameva. Apare evaṃ vadanti “kuṭivatthukāravihāravatthukārakāle
analyzed: abaddha sīmāya vā kātabbam eva apare evam vadanti kuṭi vatthukāra vihāra vatthukāra kāle
translated: Others say that when a dwelling or a monastery is being built,

original: tāni kuṭivihāravatthūni kathaṃ sīmaṭṭhā kātuṃ sakkhissanti, tasmā tattha tattheva
analyzed: tāni kuṭivihāra vatthūni katham sīmaṭṭhā kātum sakkhissanti tasmā tattha tattha iva
translated: how can the site for the dwelling or the monastery be made within the territory? Therefore it should be done right there

original: kuṭivihārakaraṇaṭṭhāneyeva kātabba”nti, taṃ tesaṃ vacanamattameva, na sārato paccetabbaṃ.
analyzed: kuṭivihāra karaṇa ṭṭhāneya iva kātabbanti tam tesam vacana mattam eva na sārataḥ paccetabbam
translated: at the site where the dwelling or the monastery is being built. But that is just their opinion, and it should not be accepted as correct.

original: Vatthuparāmasanamevettha pamāṇaṃ, tathā hi saṅghakuṭivatthuṃ olokentaṃ yācatityādinā
analyzed: vatthu parāmasanam evā itthā pamāṇam tathā hi saṅgha kuṭi vatthum olokentam yācati ityādinā
translated: The only criterion is the site itself, because when the site for the dwelling or the monastery is being inspected, the motion is made after the site has been pointed out,

original: vatthuparāmasanaṃ katvā heṭṭhā vatthuñattidose ca vipatti lakkhaṇe ca vajjetvā ñattidutiyakammena
analyzed: vatthu parāmasanam katvā heṭṭhā vatthu ñatti dose ca vipatti lakkhaṇe ca vajjetvā ñatti dutiya kammena
translated: and then the transaction is done by means of a motion and a single announcement, after the faults of the site have been declared and the characteristics of failure have been stated.🔽The monks who have been appointed

original: sammatabhikkhūhi tattha kuṭivihāraṭṭhānaṃ gantvā oloketabbaṃ teneva pāḷiyaṃ “tehi
analyzed: sammata bhikkhūhi tattha kuṭivihāra ṭṭhānam gantvā oloketabbam tena iva pāḷiyam tehi
translated: should go to the site of the dwelling or the monastery and inspect it.

original: sammatehi bhikkhūhi tattha gantvā kuṭivatthu oloketabba”nti vuttaṃ. Aññathā pattacīvaravirahitaṃ
analyzed: sammatehi bhikkhūhi tattha gantvā kuṭi vatthu oloketabbanti vuttam aññathā patta cīvara virahitam
translated: and the monks who have agreed should go there and inspect the site for the hut.”🔽Otherwise, if they were to give the full ordination to a person who did not have a bowl and robes,

original: puggalaṃ vā anupajjhāyakaṃ vā katvā upasampādentehi “paripuṇṇassa pattacīvara”nti
analyzed: puggalam vā anupajjhāyakam vā katvā upasampādentehi paripuṇṇassa patta cīvaranti
translated: or who did not have a preceptor, and if they were to say, “He has a bowl and robes,”

original: vā “itthannāmassa upasampadāpekkho, itthannāmena upajjhāyenā”ti kammavācāya sāvitepi
analyzed: vā itthannāmassa upasampada apekkhaḥ itthannāmena upajjhāyena ati kamma vācāya sāvite pi
translated: or if they were to say, “So-and-so, who is seeking the full ordination with such-and-such as his preceptor,” and then perform the full ordination,🔽the procedure would be invalid.

original: kammassa asijjhanaṃ bhaveyya. Apare evaṃ vadanti “sīmāsammutikāle pana kataṃ, tathā
analyzed: kammassa a sijjhanam bhaveyya apare evam vadanti sīmā sammuti kāle pana katam tathā
translated: Others say that the agreement on the monastery zone was made at the time of the agreement on the monastery zone.

original: hi sīmāsammutikāle bhikkhū tasmiṃ yeva ṭhāne ṭhatvā kammavācaṃ sāventi, tasmimpi
analyzed: hi sīmā sammuti kāle bhikkhū tasmim yā iva ṭhāne ṭhatvā kamma vācam sāventi tasmim pi
translated: For at the time of the agreement on the monastery zone, the monks stood right there and performed the proclamation. And right there,🔽there was no established monastery zone. If there had been,

original: ṭhāne abaddhasīmāva hoti. Yadi baddhasīmā bhaveyya, sīmajjhottharaṇaṃ vā sīmasambhedo🔽vā siyā”ti. Saccaṃ, tathāpi taṃ sīmāsammutiṭṭhānaṃ bhujissaṃ katvā sīmasammutikammassakatattā
analyzed: ṭhāne abaddha sīmā ava hoti yadi baddha sīmā bhaveyya sīmajjha uttharaṇam vā sīma sambhedaḥ  vā siyāti saccam tathā api tam sīmā sammuti ṭṭhānam bhujissam katvā sīma sammuti kammassa kata ttā
translated: then the monastery zone would have been crossed or the monastery zone would have been divided.

original: visuṃgāme sammatānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ gāmasīme ṭhitā bhikkhū kammaṃ kopetuṃ na sakkonti.
analyzed: visuṃgāme sammatānam bhikkhūnam gāma sīme ṭhitāḥ bhikkhū kammam kopetum na sakkonti
translated: This is correct, but even so, the monks who had agreed in the other villages were unable to perform the procedure, because the site for the agreement on the monastery zone was the basis for the procedure of the agreement on the monastery zone.

original: Yadi sīmasammutiṭṭhānaṃ bhujissaṃ katvāva sīmaṃ sammanneyya, kathaṃ bhagavato dharamānakāle🔽chabbaggiyā bhikkhu yathāsukhaṃ sīmaṃ sammannissantīti na panevaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ tathā
analyzed: yadi sīma sammuti ṭṭhānam bhujissam katvā ava sīmam sammanneyya katham bhagavataḥ dharamāna kāle  chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhu yathāsukham sīmam sammannissanti iti na pana evam daṭṭhabbam tathā
translated: If the place for the proclamation of the resolution were to be included in the territory, how could the six-month period for the Blessed One’s journey be

original: hi vāsākhā migāramātāpi navakoṭīhi bhūmiṃ gaṇhitvā pubbārāmaṃ nāma mahā vihāraṃ kāresi,
analyzed: hi vāsākhā migāra mātā api nava koṭīhi bhūmim gaṇhitvā pubbārāmam nāma mahā vihāram kāresi
translated: observed? It should not be regarded in this way. For even though the Blessed One’s journey was thus, still Vāsā, the mother of Migāra, having bought the land for nine million, built the great monastery called the Eastern Park,

original: tathā anāthapiṇḍiko kahāpaṇasanthatena jetassa rājakumārassa uyyānaṭṭhānaṃ kiṇāpetvā🔽gaṇhitvā jetavanaṃ nāma mahāvihāraṃ kāresi evaṃ puññakāmā pariveṇaṃ katvā vihāraṃ
analyzed: tathā anāthapiṇḍiko kahāpaṇa santhatena jetassa rāja kumārassa uyyāna ṭṭhānam kiṇāpetvā  gaṇhitvā jetavanam nāma mahā vihāram kāresi evam puñña kāmā pariveṇam katvā vihāram
translated: and Anāthapiṇḍika, having bought the prince Jeta’s pleasure garden for as much as it would take to cover it with coins,

original: karonti tasmā chabbaggiyā bhikkhū yathāsukhaṃ sīmaṃ bandhantīti daṭṭhabbanti. Ayaṃ
analyzed: karonti tasmā chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū yathāsukham sīmam bandhanti iti daṭṭhabbanti ayam
translated: and having bought the land, built the great monastery called the Jeta’s Wood. Thus those who desire merit make a park and then build a monastery. Therefore it should not be regarded that the six-month period for the Blessed One’s journey was observed by the six-month period for the proclamation of the resolution of the territory. This is the

original: upacārasīmāya vicāraṇā.
analyzed: upacāra sīmāya vicāraṇā
translated: consideration of the conventional territory.

original: Samānasaṃvāsasīmā nāma diṭṭhisīlasāmaññasaṅghātasaṅkhātehi bhikkhugaṇehi uposathādisaṅghakammena
analyzed: samāna saṃvāsa sīmā nāma diṭṭhi sīla sāmañña saṅghāta saṅkhātehi bhikkhu gaṇehi uposatha ādi saṅgha kammena
translated: The territory of common affiliation is the territory of the community of bhikkhus who are in agreement in the view of the Teaching and in the practice of virtue, and who perform the community’s functions such as the Uposatha ceremony.

original: samānaṃ ekībhāvaṃ hutvā vasituṃ sammatā sīmā. Avippavāsasīmā nāma ticīvarena vippavasituṃ
analyzed: samānam ekībhāvam hutvā vasitum sammatā sīmā avippavāsasīmā nāma ti cīvarena vippavasitum
translated: It is called a “boundary of separation” because it is agreed upon for the purpose of living apart with one’s three robes.

original: sammatā sīmā, etā dvesīmā tiyojanaparamatāyapi sambhavato mahāsīmā tipi nāmaṃ labhanti,
analyzed: sammatā sīmā etāḥ sambhavataḥ mahāsīmā nāmam labhanti
translated: Since these two kinds of boundaries can be as much as three leagues in extent, they are called “large boundaries”.

original: tāsaṃ vicāraṇā mahāaṭṭhakathāyaṃ sabbaso paripuṇṇaṃ katvā vuttā, tasmā idha na vakkhāma
analyzed: tāsam vicāraṇā mahā aṭṭhakathā ayam sabbaso paripuṇṇam katvā vuttā tasmai idha na vakkhāma
translated: The discussion of these is given in full in the Mahā commentary, and so we will not deal with it here.

original: vuccamānampi avisesetvā vuttaṃ bhaveyya, tasmā na vakkhāma.
analyzed: vuccamānam pi a visesetvā vuttam bhaveyya tasmā na vakkhāma
translated: If we were to deal with it, it would be said without distinction, and so we will not deal with it.

original: Lābhasīmā nāma yaṃ gāmaṃ vā nigamaṃ vā pokkharaṇītaḷākavanādikaṃ vā yaṃ yaṃ padesaṃ
analyzed: lābha sīmā nāma yam gāmam vā nigamam vā pokkharaṇī taḷāka vana ādikam vā yam yam padesam
translated: A “boundary of gain” is a place—whether a village, a town, a lotus-pond, a lake, a wood, or whatever—

original: saṅghassa catuccappayatthāya rājarājamahāmattehi paricchinditvā ṭhapitā, esā lābhasīmā
analyzed: saṅghassa catuccappaya tthāya rāja rāja mahāmattehi paricchinditvā ṭhapitā esā lābha sīmā
translated: that has been set aside by a king or a king’s minister for the purpose of the Sangha’s four requisites. This is called a “boundary of gain”.

original: nāma. Neva sammāsambuddhena anuññātā, na dhammasaṅgahakattherehi ṭhapitā, api ca
analyzed: nāma nā iva sammāsambuddhena anuññātā na dhammasaṅgahaka therehi ṭhapitā api ca
translated: It is not approved by the Buddha, nor is it set up by the compilers of the Dhamma.

original: kho lābhadāyakehi ṭhapitāva. Mātikāṭṭhakathāya līnatthappakāsaniyampi lābhasīmāti
analyzed: kho lābha dāyakehi ṭhapitā ava mātikā aṭṭhakathāya līna attha pakāsaniyam pi lābha sīmā ati
translated: Rather, it is set up by the donors. In the discussion of the “Enumeration of offences” in the commentary, the “boundary of gain” is explained as follows:

original: yaṃ rājarājamahāmattādayo vihāraṃ kāretvā gāvutaṃ vā aḍḍhayojanaṃ vā yojanaṃ vā samantā
analyzed: yam rāja rāja mahāmatta ādayaḥ vihāram kāretvā gāvutam vā aḍḍha yojanam vā yojanam vā samantā
translated: When kings, royal ministers, etc., have a monastery built and have a boundary set round it, a gāvuta (about 1200 yards) or half a yojana or a yojana on every side,

original: paricchinditvā “ayaṃ amhākaṃ vihārassa lābhasīmā, yaṃ etthantare uppajjati, taṃ sabbaṃ
analyzed: paricchinditvā ayam amhākam vihārassa lābha sīmā yat etthantare uppajjati tat sabbam
translated: saying, “This is the boundary of the gains of our monastery. Whatever arises within this boundary🔽we give to our monastery,” this is called a “boundary of gains.”

original: amhākaṃ vihārassa demā”ti ṭhapenti, ayaṃ lābhasīmā nāmā’ti vuttaṃ. Imasmiṃ lābhasīmādhikāre🔽rañño mahācetiyadāyakassa divaṅgatakālato ekasmiṃ saṃvacchare atīte tassa jeṭṭhaputtassa
analyzed: amhākam vihārassa dema iti ṭhapenti ayam lābha sīmā nāma ati vuttam imasmin lābha sīmā adhikāre  raññaḥ mahā cetiya dāyakassa divaṅgata kālataḥ ekasmin saṃvacchare atīte tassa jeṭṭha puttassa
translated: In the case of this “boundary of gains,”🔽it was in the time of King Dhammāsoka, the eldest son of King Asoka the Great, the giver of the Great Relic Shrine, a year after his father’s death, that such a meritorious deed as this was done.

original: dhammarañño kāle īdisaṃ puññaṃ bhūtapubbaṃ. Yadi hi rājarājamahāmattādīsu yo koci
analyzed: dhammarañño kāle īdisam puññam bhūta pubbam yadi hi rāja rāja mahāmatta ādīsu yaḥ koci
translated: For if any one of the kings, royal ministers, etc.,

original: yassa vihārassa yāni taḷākakhettavatthādīni datvā taṃ sahitavihāraṃ puggalassa deti,🔽evaṃ sati kiṃ tassa puggalassa taṃ sahitavihāraṃ puggalikabhāvena paṭiggahetuṃ vaṭṭati,
analyzed: yassa vihārassa yāni taḷāka khetta vattha ādīni da tvā tam sahita vihāram puggalassa deti  evam sati kim tassa puggalassa tam sahita vihāram puggalika bhāvena paṭiggahetum vaṭṭati
translated: gives to a person a monastery together with its fields, tanks, etc., that have been given to it,🔽then is it allowable for that person to accept that monastery together with its fields, etc., as his own private property,

original: udāhu saṅghikabhāvenevāti taḷākakhettavatthādivirahito pana kevalo puggalikavihāro
analyzed: udāhu saṅghika bhāvena iva ati taḷāka khetta vattha ādi virahitaḥ pana kevalaḥ puggalika vihāraḥ
translated: or is it allowable only as the property of the Community? But a private monastery devoid of fields, tanks, etc.,

original: aññesaṃ dammīti adatvā puggale mate saṅghiko hoti, udāhu puggalikoyevāti. Tatrāyaṃ
analyzed: aññesam dammi iti a datvā puggale mate saṅghikaḥ hoti udāhu tatra ayam
translated: If he says, “I give to others,” then when the person is dead, does it belong to the Community or to the individual?

original: vissajjanā, yadi hi rājarājamahāmattādīsu yokoci vihārassa taḷākakhettāvatthādīni
analyzed: vissajjanā yadi hi rāja rāja mahāmatta ādīsu vihārassa taḷāka khetta avattha ādīni

analyzed: pāsāda paribhoganti vacanataḥ puggalike pi senāsane senāsana paribhoga vasena niyamitam  suvaṇṇa ghaṭa ādikam paribhuñjitum na vaṭṭamānam api kevalam santakam katvā paribhuñjitum  na vaṭṭati iti vacanena api avirodhaḥ siyā tathā senāsane kiñci
translated: and “a dwelling is a dwelling for the use of the whole Order” , it is limited to the use of a dwelling by a person in a dwelling belonging to an individual.🔽and “what is not allowable to use is not allowable to use even by making it one’s own” , it is not contradictory to the statement in the Saratthadīpanī.

original: paṭisedhetabbaṃ natthi aññatra viruddhasenāsananā”ti aṭṭhakathāvacanenāpi saṃsandameva.
analyzed: paṭisedhetabbam natthi aññatra aṭṭhakathā vacanena api saṃsandam eva
translated: and “there is nothing in a dwelling that should be refused except a dwelling that is unsuitable” , it is consistent with the statement in the Commentary.🔽and “Monks, what I have not prohibited is allowable.

original: Tathā “yaṃ bhikkhave mayā idaṃ na kappatīti appaṭikkhittaṃ, taṃ ce kappiyaṃ anulometi,
analyzed: tathā yam bhikkhave mayā idam na kappati iti a paṭikkhittam tam ce kappiyam anuloma iti
translated: If it is allowable and it conforms to what is allowable,

original: akappiyaṃ paṭibāhati, taṃ vo kappatī”ti iminā suttānulomenapisaṃndameva. Kathaṃ “anujānāmi
analyzed: akappiyam paṭibāhati tam vaḥ kappati iti iminā katham anujānāmi
translated: and it rejects what is not allowable, it is allowable for you” , it is consistent with the Thread.

original: bhikkhave pañcaleṇāni vihārantyā”dinā anuññātavihārassa paṭiggahitatthā. Tappaṭibaddhacīvarādikappiyapaccayasseva
analyzed: bhikkhave pañca leṇāni vihāra nti ādinā anuññāta vihārassa paṭiggahita tthā tad paṭibaddha cīvara ādi kappiya paccayassa iva
translated: and “I allow you, monks, to live in the five kinds of dwelling” , it is the meaning of the acceptance of a dwelling that is allowed. It is the condition of what is allowable, namely, robe-material, etc., that is dependent on that dwelling.

original: paribhuñjitattā ca vihārapiṇḍapātagilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhārāpi bhikkhussa sabbakappiyā🔽kappiyānulomā ca honti. Evaṃ suttasuttānulomaācariyavādaattanomatīhi saṃsandanato🔽aññadatthu gaṅgodakena yamunodakaṃ viya khettavatthādisahitavihāro puggalikabhāvenāpi
analyzed: paribhuñjita ttā ca vihāra piṇḍapāta gilāna paccaya bhesajja parikkhārā api bhikkhussa sabba kappiyā  kappiya anulomā ca honti evam sutta sutta anuloma ācariya vāda atta nomatīhi saṃsandanato  gaṅgā udakena yamunā udakam viya khetta vattha ādi sahita vihāro puggalika bhāvena api
translated: And because they are used, the dwelling, alms food, medicine for the sick, and requisites, are all allowable for the bhikkhu.🔽And they are in conformity with what is allowable. Thus the dwelling together with the field, the site, etc., should be received as the individual’s property by the experts in the Discipline, who see what is allowable and what is not, after reconciling it by the three means of “text, text,” “penance, rule,” and “teacher, tradition.”

original: paṭiggahetabboti kappiyā kappiyāni vinayakovidehi daṭṭhabbo. Ayaṃ isinagaravāsīnaṃ
analyzed: paṭiggahetabbaḥ ti kappiyā kappiyāni vinaya kovidehi daṭṭhabbaḥ ayam isi nagara vāsīnam
translated: In this way the water of the Ganges is mixed with the water of the Yamunā.

original: mahātherānaṃ samānavissajjanā.
analyzed: mahā therānam samāna vissajjanā
translated: This is the joint decision of the great elders who lived at Isipatana.🔽“Those people who, having agreed, took away the heavy goods,

analyzed: ye ca janāḥ garu bhaṇḍam saṃvidhāya avaharum dhura nikkhepaḥ ca hoti pārājikam an āpannā pañhām esā kusalehi cintitā ati  ayam pañhā saṅghika bhūmithenake bhikkhu sandhāya vuttā tattha hi paccuppanna saṅghassa

This question was thought out by the skilled ones.”🔽This question was asked with reference to a bhikkhu who had a piece of land belonging to the Community. For there is no taking away because of the laying down of the burden by the present Community,

original: dhuranikkhepena cātuddisikasaṅghassa dhuranikkhepābhāvato avahāro natthīti. Ayaṃ
analyzed: dhura nikkhepena cātuddisika saṅghassa dhura nikkhepa abhāvataḥ avahāraḥ natthi iti ayaṃ

original: lābhasimāya vicāraṇā.

translated: This is the consideration of the “field of gain.”

original: Gāmasīmānigamasīmānagarasīmā pana pākaṭāyeva. Tāsaṃ pana viseso evaṃ veditabbo yasmiṃ

analyzed: pana padese āpaṇam eva atthi na pākāra parikkhittam pākāra parikkhittam eva vā atthi
translated: But in a place where there is a market and no enclosure, or an enclosure and no market,

analyzed: na āpaṇam ayam padesaḥ gāmaḥ nāma yasmim pana ṭhāne atthi na pana āpaṇa pākārā  santi ayam padesaḥ nigamaḥ nāma yattha pana āpaṇam pi atthi pākāra parikkhittam pi
translated: that place is called a village. But in a place where there is a village and no market or enclosure,🔽that place is called a town. But in a place where there is a market and an enclosure,

analyzed: ayam padesaḥ nagaram nāma ayam padesaḥ nāgāravanti ettha ati vacana atthena rājūnam vā

analyzed: vicitta devāyatanam pāsā dāpaṇa mandiram
translated: “A city is a place with various shrines, Palaces, markets, and mansions,

analyzed: nagaram dassaye vidvā rājamaggaḥ pasobhitanti
translated: A wise man should show a city, A royal highway, and a crossroad.”

original: Vuttaṃ. Evaṃ gāmanigamanagarānaṃ visesaṃ ñatvā gāmoyeva gāmasīmā, nigamoyeva nigamasīmā,
analyzed: vuttam evam gāma nigama nagarānam visesam ñatvā gāmaḥ yā iva gāma sīmā nigamaḥ yā iva nigama sīmā

analyzed: nagaram eva nagara sīmā ati tāsam vacana atthaḥ veditabbaḥ tattha yam padesam a sammatāya

analyzed: bhikkhave sīmāya aṭhapitāya yam gāmam vā nigamam vā upanissāya viharati yā tassa

analyzed: gāmassa vā gāma sīmā nigamassa vā nigama sīmā ayam tattha samāna saṃvāsā eka uposathā ati  anuññātam tasmim padese sabbaḥ api vā gāma padesaḥ yam pi ekasmin yeva gāma khette ekam

analyzed: padesam ayam visum gāmaḥ hotu iti paricchinditvā rājā kassaci deti saḥ api visuṃgāma sīmā

analyzed: na pana gāma sīmā mattam eva tena iva āha samantapāsādikāya vinaya ṭṭhakathāya  yattake padese tassa gāmassa gāma bhojakāḥ balim labhanti saḥ padesaḥ appaḥ vā hotu

original: Ayaṃ gāma nigamanagarasīmānaṃ vicāraṇā.
analyzed: ayam nigama nagara sīmānam vicāraṇā
translated: This is the discussion of the boundaries of villages, towns, and cities.

For this is the cubit in use in the world, that is to say, twenty-four fingers’ breadths, and five of these cubits make one hasta. Twenty-four hastas make one bow. Five hundred bows make one kosa. This is the measure of a kosa in the world. But in the Dispensation the measure of a kosa is given as five hundred gāvutas. And a gāvuta is the distance a pair of oxen can walk in a day. translated: This is said. Hence it is said, “Therein, one abbhantara is twenty-four handspans in extent.” And here in the phrase “in an uninhabited place” the meaning of the letter a is what? For the letter a is🔽In denial, in increase,

analyzed: paṭisedhe vuddhi tad bhāve aññatthe sadise pi ca
translated: In a meaning other, in a similar one,🔽In contradiction, in censure, in voidness,

original: ādīsu vuddhimhi. “Anavajjaṃ bhante”ti ādīsu tabbhāve akkharā’ti ādīsu aññatthe. “Amaru🔽rājā”tiādīsu sadise. “Amala”nti ādīsu viruddhe. “Aseṭṭhoyaṃ brāhmaṇo abrahmacārī”ti🔽ādīsu garahe. “Agāmo”ti ādīsu suññe. “Apatikāyaṃitthī”ti ādīsu virahe. “Atha nāyaṃ🔽kaññā”ti ādīsu appake. Idha pana suññe virahe vā daṭṭhabbo. Suññatthena pana agāmake🔽nimanusse kevalāraññeti attho. Virahattho vā agāmake gāmavirahite padeseti attho
analyzed: ādīsu vuddhimhi anavajjam bhante ti ādīsu tad bhāve akkharā ati ādīsu aññatthe  rājā ati ādīsu sadise ādīsu viruddhe a seṭṭhaḥ yam brāhmaṇaḥ a brahmacārī iti  ādīsu garahe agāma iti ādīsu suññe a patikāyam itthī iti ādīsu virahe atha na ayam  kaññā ti ādīsu appake idha pana suññe virahe vā daṭṭhabbo suñña tthena pana a gāmake  kevala araññā iti atthaḥ viraha atthaḥ vā agāmake gāma virahite padese iti atthaḥ
translated: In such words as ‘growth’ it is in the sense of increase. In such words as ‘blameless’ it is in the sense of thatness. In such words as ‘the letter a’ it is in the sense of a different meaning. In such words as ‘the king of the immortals’ it is in the sense of similarity. In such words as ‘stainless’ it is in the sense of contradiction. In such words as ‘This brahmin is not a good man, he is not a celibate’ it is in the sense of censure. In such words as ‘non-village’ it is in the sense of void. In such words as ‘a woman without a husband’ it is in the sense of absence. In such words as ‘but she is not a virgin’ it is in the sense of littleness. But here it should be understood in the sense of void or absence. In the sense of void, the meaning is ‘in a wilderness that is a place without villages, without human beings, a pure wilderness.’ Or in the sense of absence, the meaning is ‘in a place without villages, in a place devoid of villages.’🔽

original: daṭṭhabbo. Teneva suññatthena virahatthena “agāmake”timināpadena gāmanadījātassarasamudde🔽muñcitvā yaṃ anavasesaṃ heṭṭhā pathavīsandhārakaudakampiudakasandhārako vātopi ajaṭākāsampi,
analyzed: daṭṭhabbo tena iva suñña tthena viraha tthena gāma nadī jāta ssara samudde  muñcitvā yam anavasesam heṭṭhā pathavī sandhāraka odakampi udaka sandhārakaḥ vātaḥ api
translated: In the first of the above examples it is in the sense of growth. In the second it is in the sense of the state of being blameless. In the third it is in the sense of a letter. In the fourth it is in the sense of a simile. In the fifth it is in the sense of the opposite. In the sixth it is in the sense of censure. In the seventh it is in the sense of emptiness. In the eighth it is in the sense of absence. In the ninth it is in the sense of smallness. But here it should be understood in the sense of emptiness or absence. In the sense of emptiness it means “uninhabited by human beings, a wilderness.” In the sense of absence it means “a place without a village, a place devoid of a village.” Therefore, by the word “agāmaka” in the sense of emptiness or absence, the entire ocean, with the exception of the islands, is meant, as well as the water that supports the earth below, and the sky that is not occupied by the celestial palaces of the gods and Brahmas, up to the highest Brahma world.

original: tathā yāva uparibrahmalokaṃ upādāya sabbaṃ asurayakkhasurādiākāsaṭṭhakadevabrahmavimānānipi
analyzed: tathā yāva upari brahmalokam upādāya sabbam asura yakkha sura ādi ākāsaṭṭhaka deva brahma vimānāni pi
translated: And the entire space occupied by the celestial palaces of the Asuras, Yakkhas, gods, and Brahmas, from the lowest to the highest Brahma world,

original: araññantveva saṅgahitā. Nadīsamuddantaresupi macchabandhānaṃ agamanapatho dīpako🔽vā pabbato vā, sopi araññasīmātveva saṅkhyaṃ gacchati, tasmā ayaṃ sattabbhantarasīmā

translated: And also an island or a rock in the middle of a river or the sea, which is a passage for fishermen, is reckoned as the boundary of the forest.

translated: This is the meaning here. … Just as dice-players, when they pick up a dice with their hand,

original: attano balaṃ dassentā viya sabbathāmena attānaṃ onamitvā khipanti, evameva thāmamajjhimena
analyzed: attanaḥ balam dassentāḥ viya sabba thāmena attānam onamitvā khipanti evam eva thāma majjhimena
translated: show their strength by bending it all the way down, so too, a man of medium strength

original: purisena udakaṃ vā vālikaṃ vā hatthena gahetvā attano balaṃ dassentāviya onamitvā
analyzed: purisena udakam vā vālikam vā hatthena gahetvā attanaḥ balam dassenta aviya onamitvā
translated: picks up water or sand with his hand, showing his strength by bending it all the way down.

original: sabbathāmena nisinnassa vā ṭhitassa vā parisapariyantato anupariyāyitvā khipitabbaṃ,🔽evaṃ cittaṃ udakaṃ vā vālikaṃ vā yattha yasmiṃ ṭhāne patati, ayameko udakukkhepo🔽nāmāti “ayameko udakukkhepo”ti iminā padena dvinnaṃ saṅghānaṃ visuṃvisuṃ kammakaraṇādhikāre
analyzed: sabbathāmena nisinnassa vā ṭhitassa vā parisa pariyantataḥ anupariyāyitvā khipitabbam  evam cittam udakam vā vālikam vā yattha yasmin ṭhāne patati ayam ekaḥ udakukkhepo  nāma ati ayam ekaḥ udakukkhepo ti iminā padena dvinnam saṅghānam visum visum kamma karaṇa adhikāre
translated: When sitting or standing, he should throw it all the way to the edge of the assembly.🔽This is called one throwing of the water.

original: sīmantarikattā aññassāpi udakukkhepassa sambhavaṃ dasseti, teneva mātikāṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: sīmantarika ttā aññassa api udakukkhepassa sambhavam dasseti tena iva mātikā aṭṭhakathā ayam
translated: “This is called one throwing of the water”: by this phrase, he shows that because of the difference in the two assemblies, there is a possibility of a second throwing of the water,🔽in the sense of the authority to do the legal procedures separately. Therefore, in the commentary to the mātikā,

original: “sace pana dve saṅghā visuṃvisuṃ uposathādikammaṃ karonti, dvinnaṃ udakukkhepānaṃ
analyzed: sace pana dve saṅghāḥ visum visum uposatha ādi kammam karonti dvinnam udakukkhepānam
translated: it is said, “But if the two assemblies do the observance-day ceremony and other legal procedures separately, there are two throwings of the water.

original: antare añño eko udakukkhepo upacāratthāya ṭhapetabbo”ti vuttaṃ, vimativinodaniyampi
analyzed: antare aññaḥ ekaḥ udakukkhepaḥ upacāra atthāya ṭhapetabbaḥ iti vuttam vimati vinodaniyam pi
translated: And in the Vimativinodani:

original: “tassa antoti tassa udakukkhepaparicchinnassa ṭhānassa anto na kevalañca tasseva🔽anto, tato bahipi ekassa udakukkhepassa anto ṭhātuṃ na vaṭṭatīti vacanaṃ udakukkhepaparicchedassa
analyzed: tassa antaḥ ti tassa udakukkhepa paricchinnassa ṭhānassa antaḥ na kevalam ca tassa iva  antar tatas bahi pi ekassa uda kukkhepassa antar ṭhātum na vaṭṭati iti vacanam uda kukkhepa paricchedassa
translated: “The meaning of ‘within it’ is that it is not allowable to stay within the area defined by the water-throwing,🔽not only within that but also within the area defined by the water-throwing outside it.”

original: dubbijānato kammakopasaṅkā hotī”ti vuttaṃ, sāratthadīpaniyaṃ pana “tassa anto hatthapāsaṃ🔽vijahitvā ṭhito kammaṃ kopetīti iminā paricchedato bahi yattha katthaci ṭhito kammaṃ
analyzed: dubbijānataḥ kamma kopa saṅkā hoti iti vuttam sāratthadīpaniyam pana tassa antar hattha pāsam  vijahitvā ṭhitaḥ kammam kopeti iti iminā paricchedataḥ bahi yattha katthaci ṭhitaḥ kammaṃ
translated: And in the Sārattha-dīpanī: “The statement that ‘there is cause for the schism of the Order because the definition of the area by the water-throwing is difficult to understand’🔽shows that wherever one stands outside the definition by the water-throwing one does not cause a schism of the Order.”

original: na kopetīti dīpetī”ti vatvā mātikāṭṭhakathāvacanampi paṭikkhipi, taṃ ekasaṅghaṃ sannipātaṃ🔽sandhāya vuttanti daṭṭhabbaṃ, yathā ca mahāsīmāya khaṇḍitvā baddhānaṃ khaṇḍasīmānaṃ
analyzed: na kopeti iti dīpeti iti vatvā mātikā aṭṭhakathā vacanam pi paṭikkhipi tam eka saṅgham sannipātam  sandhāya vuttan ti daṭṭhabbam yathā ca mahā sīmāya khaṇḍitvā baddhānam khaṇḍa sīmānam
translated: But in the Sārattha-pakāsinī the statement in the Mātikāṭṭhakathā is rejected, and it should be understood that it was made with reference to an Order that had assembled in one place.🔽And just as a boundary is set up between two adjacent boundaries that have been made by dividing a large boundary,

original: aññamaññasaṅkaravivajjanatthaṃ sīmantarikā ṭhapitā, evameva attano sabhāvena gāmasīmā
analyzed: aññamañña saṅkara vivajjana attham sīmantarikā ṭhapitā evam eva attano sabhāvena gāmasīmā
translated: in order to avoid confusion between them, so too a village boundary is set up in order to avoid confusion between the village and the surrounding area.

original: viya sayaṃ jātasīmāyaṃ nadīsamuddajātassarānaṃ atimahantabhāvena udakukkhepena udakukkhepasīmā
analyzed: viya sayam jāta sīmāyam nadī samudda jāta ssarānam ati mahanta bhāvena udakukkhepena udakukkhepa sīmā
translated: Just as the boundary of the ocean is the boundary of the rivers that flow into it, so the boundary of the water drawn in is the boundary of the water of the rivers and the tanks, etc., that flow into it.

original: bhagavatā anuññātā, tathāpi dvinnaṃ baddhasīmānamiva aññamaññasaṅkaravivajjanatthaṃ
analyzed: bhagavatā anuññātā tathā api dvinnam baddha sīmānam iva aññamañña saṅkara vivajjana ttham
translated: But even so, in order to avoid confusion between the two boundaries,

original: dvinnaṃ udakukkhepasīmānaṃ antare sīmantarikatthāya añño udakukkhepo ṭhapetabbo’ti🔽vuttaṃ, sanimittā baddhasīmā, saudakukkhepā udakukkhepasīmā, sīmantarikā viya eko🔽udakukkhepo daṭṭhabbo, teneva vimativinodaniyaṃ “idañcettha sīmantarikāvidhānaṃ dvinnaṃ
analyzed: dvinnam udakukkhepa sīmānam antare sīmantarika tthāya aññaḥ udakukkhepaḥ ṭhapetabbaḥ ti  vuttam sa nimittā baddha sīmā sa udakukkhepā udakukkhepa sīmā sīmantarikā viya ekaḥ  udakukkhepaḥ daṭṭhabbo tena iva vimati vinodaniyam idam ca ittha sīmantarikā vidhānam dvinnam
translated: it is said that “another drawing in of the water should be performed within the two boundaries of the water drawn in, in order to make a space between them.”🔽The boundary with signs is the bounda ry of the resolution with signs. The boundary of the water drawn in is the boundary of the resolution of the water drawn in. The space between them is like the space between two bounda ries.

original: baddhasīmānaṃ sīmantarikāanujānanasuttānulomato siddhanti daṭṭhabba”nti vuttaṃ, ekasmiṃ
analyzed: baddha sīmānam sīmantarikā anujānana sutta anulomato siddhanti daṭṭhabbanti vuttam ekasmin
translated: One drawing in of the water should be regarded as being like the space between them. That is why it is said in the Vimativinodani: “The method of the space between them should be understood to be in accordance with the sutta that allows the space between two bounda ries.”

original: saṅghasannipāte pana ekassa udakukkhepassa bahi tiṭṭhantopi kammaṃ na kopetīti daṭṭhabbaṃ
analyzed: saṅgha sannipāte pana ekassa udakukkhepassa bahi tiṭṭhantaḥ api kammam na kopeti iti daṭṭhabbam
translated: But it should be understood that if one stands outside the one drawing in of the water at a single meeting of the Sangha, he does not invalidate the kamma.

original: vuttañhi vimativinodaniyaṃ bhagavatā nidānavasena ekagāmasīmanissitānaṃ ekasabhāgānañca
analyzed: vuttam hi vimati vinodaniyam bhagavatā nidāna vasena eka gāma sīma nissitānam eka sabhāgānam ca
translated: For it is said in the Vimativinodani: “The Blessed One, in the Nidana, allowed the space between two bounda ries for those who are of the same affiliation and who are dependent on a single monastery boundary.”

original: dvinnaṃ baddhasīmānameva aññamaññaṃ sambhedajjhottharaṇaṃ sīmantarikaṃ vinā abyavadhāne
analyzed: dvinnam baddha sīmānam eva aññam aññam sambheda ajjhottharaṇam sīmantarikam vinā a byavadhāne
translated: But the two kinds of boundary that are joined together are not separated by a boundary that is not joined together, except in the case of a boundary that is a river or the sea.🔽And the Master has allowed a place that is not joined to either of them.

original: ṭhānañca bhagavatā anumatamevāti ñatvā aṭṭhakathācariyā idhāpi sīmantarikāvidhānamakaṃsu
analyzed: ṭhānam ca bhagavatā anumatam evā iti ñatvā aṭṭhakathā cariyāḥ idha api sīmantarikā vidhānam akaṃsu
translated: So the teachers of the commentary have laid down the method of a boundary that is a river or the sea here too.

original: visabhāgasīmānampi hi ekasīmanissitattaṃ ekasabhāvattañcāti dvīhaṅgehi samannāgate
analyzed: visabhāga sīmānam pi hi eka sīma nissita ttam eka sabhā vattam ca ati dvīhi aṅgehi samannāgate
translated: For even if the boundaries are of different kinds, if they are endowed with the two factors of being dependent on one boundary and having one nature,🔽then a place that is not joined to either of them is separated by a boundary that is a river or the sea.

original: sati eva sīmantarikaṃ vinā ṭhānaṃ sambhedāya hoti, nāsatīti daṭṭhabba’nti. Evaṃ nadīsamuddajātassaresu
analyzed: sati eva sīmantarikam vinā ṭhānam sambhedāya hoti na asati iti daṭṭhabbanti evam nadī samudda jātassaresu
translated: But if they are not endowed with these two factors, it should be understood that it is not so.

original: samantāudakukkhepāti paññattasikkhāpadānurūpaṃ udakukkhepena paricchedaṃ dassetvā
analyzed: samantā udakukkhepā ti paññatta sikkhāpada anurūpam udakukkhepena paricchedam dassetvā
translated: Having thus shown the delimitation by the extent of the water in the case of a river or the sea, in accordance with the training precept that is laid down thus: “The extent of the water in the river or the sea is the delimitation” ,

original: rassapabhave nadījātassarapadese udakukkhepena vināva attano sabhāvena gāmasīmāyamiva
analyzed: rassapa bhave nadī jātassara padese udakukkhepena vinā ava sabhāvena
translated: and in the case of a spring that is not a river, in a place where there is a spring, the delimitation by the extent of the water does not apply, but the delimitation by the spring itself is like the delimitation by the village, and it is to be shown thus: “The spring itself is the delimitation,”

original: sabbathā kappiyabhāvaṃ dassetuṃ sace pana nātidīghā hoti, pabhavato paṭṭhāya tyādimāha.
analyzed: sabbathā kappiya bhāvam dassetum sace pana na ati dīghā hoti pabhavataḥ paṭṭhāya tyādim āha
translated: and in order to show that it is always allowable in every way, he said “If it is not too far” , starting from the spring.

original: Tattha pabhavato paṭṭhāyāti yasmiṃ padese catumāsaparamā nadī sandati, tassa uparimabhāgato
analyzed: tattha pabhavataḥ paṭṭhāyāti yasmin padese catu māsa paramā nadī sandati tassa uparima bhāgataḥ
translated: Herein, from the source onwards means from the upper reaches onwards in the region where the river flows for four months at most.

original: paṭṭhāyāti attho. Yāva mukhadvārā ti yāva nadītīramevettha mukhadvārāti adhippetā.
analyzed: paṭṭhāya iti atthaḥ yāva mukha dvārā ti yāva nadī tīram eva ittha mukha dvārā ati adhippetā
translated: As far as the mouth is as far as the river’s edge. Here the mouth is intended as the river’s edge.

original: Sabbatthā’ti sabbasmiṃ nadīpadese udakukkhepasīmākammaṃ natthī ti udakukkhepena pavattā
analyzed: sabbattha ati sabbasmin nadī padese udakukkhepa sīmākammam natthi ti udakukkhepena pavattā
translated: Everywhere means in the whole region of the river there is no making of a zone by throwing water. The zone that occurs by throwing water is called a “water- zone.”

original: sīmā udakukkhepasīmā. Karitabbanti kammaṃ, karakaraṇeti dhātu, rammapaccayo. Karaṇeti🔽manodvāravīthiyā sattamakusalajavanacittasamuṭṭhāpitavāyodhātuyā vikārabhūto kāyapayogo,🔽tena kāyapayogena khipitabbaṃ uddhaṭaṃ kammanti vuccati paramatthavasena pana kāyapayogasaṅkhātāya
analyzed: sīmā udakukkhepa sīmā karitabbanti kammam kara karaṇe iti dhātu ramma paccayaḥ karaṇe iti  manaḥ dvāra vīthiyā sattama kusala javana citta samuṭṭhāpita vāyodhātuyā vikāra bhūto kāya payogo  tena kāya payogena khipitabbam uddhaṭam kammanti vuccati paramattha vasena pana kāya payoga saṅkhātāya
translated: It should be made: kammaṃ = kamma . The root is karaṇe , the suffix raṃ , and the affix mayaṃ .🔽The bodily effort that is a modification of the air element set up by the seventh impulsion of the unwholesome consciousness in the course of the mind door is called “making.”

original: cittaṃ javāyodhātuyā vipphārena desantarappattisamuṭṭhāpikā aṭṭhakalāpapuñjāyeva.
analyzed: cittam java ayaḥ dhātuyā vipphārena desa antara ppatti samuṭṭhāpikā aṭṭha kalāpa puñjāya iva
translated: But in the ultimate sense it is only a mass of eight kinds of primaries that is the cause of the arising of a state of consciousness in another place by the propagation of the mind-door impulsion and the air element.

original: Udakukkhepasīmāya kammaṃ udakukkhepasīmākammaṃ taṃ ettha rassapabhavanadiyā natthīti
analyzed: udakukkhepa sīmāya kammam udakukkhepa sīmā kammam tam ettha rassapa bhavanadiyā natthi iti
translated: The meaning is that the procedure of a zone of influence by throwing water is not there.

original: attho. Ayañhetthattho sace nadī nātidīghā hoti aḍḍhayojanaṃ vā gāvutaṃ vā aḍḍhagāvutaṃ🔽vā, tassā pavattanaṭṭhānato paṭṭhāya yāva nadītīrā sabbattha nadīpadese ajjhottharitvā
analyzed: atthaḥ sace nadī na ati dīghā hoti aḍḍha yojanam vā gāvutam vai aḍḍha gāvutam  vā tassā pavattana ṭṭhānato paṭṭhāya yāva nadī tīrā sabbattha nadī padese ajjhottharitvā
translated: If the river is not too long, half a league, a league, or half a league,

original: saṅgho nisīdati, tattha tasmiṃ nadīpadese samantato avasesanadiyā abhāvā vaggakammasaṅkābhāvena
analyzed: saṅghaḥ nisīdati tattha tasmin nadī padese samantataḥ avasesa nadiyāḥ abhāvā vagga kamma saṅka abhāvena
translated: then the Sangha sits down everywhere in the river zone, having crossed over from the place where it flows up to the river bank.

original: udakukkhepasīmā kammaṃ natthi, kevalā nadī sīmāyevāti sāratthadīpaniyampi mātikāṭṭhakathāyalīnatthappakāsaniyampi🔽etadeva sanniṭṭhānaṃ vuttaṃ vimativinodaniyaṃ pana yattha khuddake araññe mahantehi
analyzed: udakukkhepa sīmā kammam natthi kevalā nadī sīmāya iva ati sārattha dīpaniyam pi mātikā aṭṭhakathā āyalīna ttha ppakāsaniyam pi  etat eva sanniṭṭhānam vuttam vimati vinodaniyam pana yattha khuddake araññe mahantehi
translated: There is no procedure of a zone of influence by throwing water in that river zone because there is no other river all round.🔽The only boundary is the river itself. This is the conclusion stated in the commentary on the criterion in the Dhatupakaraṇa, and in the commentary on the criterion in the Khandhakappakaraṇa.

original: vā bhikkhūhi paripuṇṇatāya vaggakammasaṅkābhāvena sattabbhantarasīmāpekkhā natthi,
analyzed: vā bhikkhūhi paripuṇṇa tāya vagga kamma saṅkā abhāvena satta bbhantara sīmā apekkhā natthi
translated: But in the Vimativinodani it is said that where there is no expectation of a zone of influence of seven houses because of the absence of any possibility of a schism due to the large number of monks in a small forest,

original: tattha satthabbhantarasīmā na uppajjati, kevalāraññasīmāyeva tattha saṅghena kammaṃ🔽kātabbaṃ nadīādīsupi eseva nayo vakkhati hi sace nadī nātidīghā hoti, pabhavato paṭṭhāya
analyzed: tattha sattha abbhantara sīmā na uppajjati kevala arañña sīmāya iva tattha saṅghena kammaṃ  kātabbam nadī ādīsu pi esā iva nayaḥ vakkhati hi sace nadī na ati dīghā hoti pabhavataḥ paṭṭhāya
translated: Here the zone of seven-league radius does not arise. Only the zone of the whole forest is there. The legal procedure must be done by the Sangha there.

original: yāvamukhadvārā sabbattha saṅgho nisīdati, udakukkhepasīmākammaṃ natthī’ti ādi ca
analyzed: yāvamukha dvārā sabbattha saṅghaḥ nisīdati udakukkhepa sīmākammam natthi iti ādi ca
translated: This is the method for rivers, etc. For it is said, ‘If the river is not too long, the Sangha sits down starting from the source and ending at the mouth. There is no legal procedure consisting of walking in the water.’

original: ubhayatthāpi ca. Yassaṃ disāyaṃ sattabbhantarassa vā udakukkhepassa vā okāso nappahoti,🔽tattha kathaṃ minanaṃ khipanaṃ vā bhaveyya, gāmakhettādīsu pavisanato akhette sīmā
analyzed: ubhayattha api ca disā ayam okāsaḥ nappahoti  tattha katham minanam khipanam vā bhaveyya gāma khetta ādīsu pavisanataḥ akhette sīmā
translated: And in both cases, in whatever direction there is no space for a zone of seven-league radius or for a procedure consisting of walking in the water,🔽how could the marking or throwing be done there? If someone enters the fields, etc., of another, and the zone is entered where there are no fields,

original: paviṭṭhā nāmātisīmā vipajjeyya, apekkhāya sīmuppattiyaṃ pana yato pahoti, tattha
analyzed: paviṭṭhā nāma ati sīmā vipajjeyya apekkhāya sīmuppattiyam pana yatas pahoti tattha
translated: the zone would fail. But when the arising of the zone depends on the expectation, then wherever there is space,

original: sattabbhantaraudakukkhepasīmā sayameva paripuṇṇā jāyanti. Yato pana nappahoti, tattha
analyzed: satta abbhantara audakukkhepa sīmā sayam eva paripuṇṇāḥ jāyanti yatas pana tattha
translated: the zone of seven-league radius or the zone consisting of walking in the water is complete there. But wherever there is no space,

original: attano khettappamāṇeneva jāyanti, na bahīti vuttaṃ, ettha ca’sīmāpekkhāya sattabbhantaraudakukkhepasīmā
analyzed: attanaḥ khetta ppamāṇena iva jāyanti na bahi iti vuttam ettha ca sīmā apekkhāya satta bbhantarā udakukkhepa sīmā
translated: it arises there only to the extent of the other’s fields, not beyond. This is what is said. And here, the zone of seven-league radius or the zone consisting of walking in the water,

original: sayameva paripuṇṇā jāyantī’ti vuttattā udakukkhepaṃ vināyeva apekkhāya sīmāya udakukkhepasīmā
analyzed: sayam eva paripuṇṇāḥ jāyanti iti vutta ttā udakukkhepam vināya iva apekkhāya sīmāya udakukkhepa sīmā
translated: “They are born complete in themselves” —🔽the “water-boundary” is a “boundary” by the throwing in of the water without the throwing in of the earth.

original: uppajjatī’ti atthaṃ vadanti, taṃ ayuttarūpaṃ viya dissati. Kasmāti ce pāḷinayavirodhato
analyzed: uppajjati iti attham vadanti tam ayutta rūpam viya dissati kasmā iti ce pāḷi naya virodhato
translated: and they are born complete in themselves.” They say that the meaning is this: “Without the proclamation of the zone by reciting the formula, the zone comes into existence by mere resolution.” But that appears to be incorrect.🔽If it be asked why, it is because of the contradiction of the method of the texts,

original: vimativinodaniyaṃ parato vuttavacanenāpi virodhato ca. Idañca vacanaṃ ācariyassa
analyzed: vimati vinodaniyam paratas vutta vacanena api virodhato ca idam ca vacanam ācariyassa
translated: and because of the contradiction of the words stated later in the Vimativinodani.

original: kesañci puggalānaṃ vādappakāsanatthaṃ vuttaṃ bhaveyya. Kasmā parato vuttavacanena
analyzed: kesañci puggalānam vāda ppakāsana attham vuttam bhaveyya kasmā paratas vutta vacanena
translated: And this statement might have been made by the teacher for the purpose of giving some people an opportunity to argue.🔽Why? Because of the non-occurrence of the argument,

original: aghaṭiyattā ca pāḷiyaṭṭhakathāṭīkāvacanehipi virujjhanato ca, taṃ parato vaṇṇayissāma.
analyzed: ca virujjhanataḥ ca tam paratas vaṇṇayissāma
translated: and because of the contradiction of the words of the texts, commentaries, and sub-commentaries. We shall deal with that later.

original: Yathā ca loke vatiṃ aparikkhipitvā “idaṃ vatiyā ṭhāna”nti ca yathā ca naṅgalakoṭiyā🔽akasitvā “idaṃ kasikaṭṭhāna”nti ca yathā ca vatthuṃ karontā manussā kudhārīpharasuādinā
analyzed: yathā ca loke vatim a parikkhipitvā idam vatiyā ca yathā ca naṅgala koṭiyā  a kasitvā idam kasika ṭṭhānan ti ca yathā ca vatthum karontā manussā
translated: And just as in the world, without defining a boundary, it is not said “This is the place for the boundary,”🔽and just as, without ploughing a furrow, it is not said “This is the place for the furrow,”🔽and just as, when people are making a site, they do not cut down trees with axes and hatchets, etc., and say “This is the place for the fall of our axes and hatchets,”

original: rukkhe acchinditvā “idaṃ mama kudhāripatanaṭṭhāna”nti ca yathā ca dāttena alāyitvā
analyzed: rukkhe a chinditvā idam mama kudhāri patana ṭṭhānan ti ca yathā ca dāttena alāyitvā
translated: and just as, when a man is not weaving, it is not said “This is the place for the shuttle,”
