translated: And like a flame that’s stilled his mind was freed.”

original: Imissāgāthāya “yaṃ yo muni anejo santi nibbānaṃ ārabbha kālaṃ akarī”ti yojetvā bhagavato🔽parinibbānacittassa nibbānārammaṇanti tamayuttaṃ, paṭisandhibhavaṅgacutīnaṃ nibbānārammaṇassa
analyzed: imissā āgāthāya yam yaḥ muni anejaḥ santi nibbānam ārabbha kālam akari iti yojetvā bhagavataḥ  parinibbāna cittassa nibbāna ārammaṇan ti tam ayuttam paṭisandhi bhavaṅga cutīnam nibbāna ārammaṇassa
translated: In this stanza, the words “the sage who, free from agitation, passed away in peace, having made Nibbāna his object” should be construed with the words “his mind was liberated from the taints by non-agitation.”

original: anārahattā “nibbānaṃ gotrabhussa vodānassa maggassa ārammaṇapaccayenapaccayo, nibbānaṃ
analyzed: anāraha ttā nibbānam gotrabhussa vodānassa maggassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ nibbānam
translated: But it is not correct to construe them with the words “his mind, which had Nibbāna as its object, attained Nibbāna.” For the mind of rebirth-linking, life-continuum, and death of an arahat does not have Nibbāna as its object.

original: phalassa āvajjanāyā”ti paṭṭhānapāḷiyā javanaāvajjanānameva adhippetattā tasmā ettha
analyzed: phalassa āvajjanāya ati paṭṭhāna pāḷiyā javana āvajjanānam eva adhippeta ttā tasmai ettha
translated: “Nibbāna is a condition, as object condition, for the path that is the forerunner of purification; Nibbāna is a condition, as object condition, for the adverting to the fruit” .🔽Therefore, in this stanza, the words “the sage who, free from agitation, passed away in peace, having made Nibbāna his object” should be construed with the words “his mind was liberated from the taints by non-agitation.”

original: “yaṃ yo muni phalasamāpattiyā anejo anejasaṅkhāto taṇhārahito santiṃ nibbānaṃ ārabbha🔽ārammaṇaṃ katvā kālaṃ asītivassaparimāṇaṃ akari atikkamī”ti yojanā kātabbā. Keci
analyzed: yam yaḥ muni phala samāpattiyā anejaḥ aneja saṅkhāto taṇhā rahitaḥ santim nibbānam ārabbha  ārammaṇam katvā kālam asīti vassa parimāṇam akari atikkami iti yojanā kātabbā keci
translated: “The sage who, free from agitation, free from craving, passed away, having made peace, Nibbāna, his object, having lived for eighty years” .🔽But some say: “In some places, the words ‘having made Nibbāna his object’ are not found.

original: pana evaṃ vadanti… “katthaci pana anuppajjamānassa khīṇāsavassa yathopaṭṭhitaṃ nāmarūpadhammādikameva
analyzed: pana evam vadanti katthaci pana anuppajjamānassa khīṇāsavassa yathā upaṭṭhitam nāma rūpa dhamma ādikam eva
translated: but they say this: “In some places, for one who is without cankers and who is not generating (a new existence), the dhammas such as mind and bodily form, which have arisen,🔽

original: cutipariyosānānaṃ gocarabhāvaṃ gacchati, na kamma-kammanimittādayo”ti vuttattā kammanittagatinimittāni🔽arahato cuticittassa ārammaṇabhāvaṃ na gacchantīti tampi ayuttameva ayañhetthattho
analyzed: cuti pariyosānānam gocara bhāvam gacchati na kamma kamma nimitta ādayaḥ ti vutta ttā kamma nitta gati nimittāni  arahataḥ cuti cittassa ārammaṇa bhāvam na gacchanti iti tat pi ayuttam eva ayam ha itthatthaḥ
translated: and not kamma, kamma-sign, etc.,” and so it is not right to say that the kamma-sign and the destiny-sign are the object of the Arahant’s death consciousness.🔽This is the meaning here.

original: katthaci pana bhave anuppajjamānassa khīṇāsavassa arahato yathā yathā yena yena pakārena
analyzed: katthaci pana bhave an uppajjamānassa khīṇāsavassa arahataḥ yathā yathā yena yena pakārena
translated: But in some becoming, when one who has no more training to do does not reappear, then the mentality-materiality, etc., that are present in whatever way,

original: upaṭṭhitaṃ nāmarūpadhammādikameva cutipariyosānaṃ āvajjanajavanacittānaṃ gocarabhāvaṃ
analyzed: upaṭṭhitam nāma rūpa dhamma ādikam eva cuti pariyosānam āvajjana javana cittānam gocara bhāvam
translated: become the object of the death consciousness and of the impulsions that precede it,

original: gacchati, puna bhavābhinibbattiyā abhāvato. Kiṃ kāraṇaṃ bhūtāni kammakammanimittagatinimittāni
analyzed: gacchati puna bhava abhinibbattiyāḥ abhāvataḥ kim kāraṇam bhūtāni kamma kamma nimitta gati nimittāni
translated: because there is no reappearance in a new becoming. Why is it that the primary elements, kamma, kamma-sign, and destiny-sign

original: gocarabhāvaṃ na gacchantīti. Cuticittassa pana paṭisandhicittena gahitaṃ atītārammaṇameva
analyzed: gocara bhāvam na gacchanti iti cuti cittassa pana paṭisandhi cittena gahitam atīta ārammaṇam eva
translated: do not become the object? But only the past object that is included in the rebirth-linking consciousness becomes the object of the death consciousness.

original: gocarabhāvaṃ gacchati. “Nāmarūpādikamevā ti ettha nāma”nti cittacetasikanibbānaṃ
analyzed: gocara bhāvam gacchati nāma rūpa ādikam evā ti ettha nāmanti citta cetasika nibbānam
translated: “Mentality-materiality, etc.”: here “mentality” is consciousness and its concomitants, and “materiality” is the four great primaries.

original: rūpanti aṭṭhārasavidhaṃ rūpaṃ saṅgaṇhāti. Nāmañca rūpañca nāmarūpā. Nāmarūpā ca te
analyzed: aṭṭhārasavidham rūpam saṅgaṇhāti nāman ca rūpam ca nāma rūpāḥ nāma rūpā ca te
translated: and “form” includes the eighteen kinds of form. “Mind-and-form” is mind and form.🔽Those states are “mind-and-form” and they are “states” too,

original: dhammā ceti tathā. Te ādi yesaṃ teti nāmarūpadhammādi tameva nāmarūpadhammādikaṃ.
analyzed: dhammā ca iti tathā te ādi yesam te iti nāma rūpa dhamma ādi tam eva nāma rūpa dhamma ādikam
translated: so they are “mind-and-form states.”

original: Ādisaddena cha paññattiyo saṅgaṇhāti, tena nibbānampi arahato maraṇāsannakāle kriyajavanassapi🔽ārammaṇabhāvo bhaveyyāti amhākaṃ khanti vīmaṃsitvā pana gahetabbaṃ. Bhagavato nibbānacittassa
analyzed: ādi saddena cha paññattiyaḥ saṅgaṇhāti tena nibbānam pi arahataḥ maraṇa āsanna kāle kriya javanassa api  ārammaṇa bhāvaḥ bhaveyyāti amhākam khanti vīmaṃsitvā pana gahetabbam bhagavataḥ nibbāna cittassa
translated: The word “etc.” includes the six kinds of determinations. Consequently, even Nibbāna would be the object of the functional processes of the Arahant at the time of his death.🔽But this should be accepted only after considering our opinion.

original: pana tusitapurato cavitvā sirīmahāmāyāya kucchimhi vasitapaṭisandhicittena gahitārammaṇameva
analyzed: pana tusita puratas cavitvā sirī mahāmāyāya kucchimhi vasita paṭisandhi cittena gahita ārammaṇam eva
translated: However, the object of the Blessed One’s Nibbāna consciousness should be regarded as being the object of the rebirth-linking consciousness that occurred in the womb of his mother, Mahāmāyā, after he had passed away from the Tusita heaven.

original: ārammaṇaṃ hotīti daṭṭhabbaṃ tañca kho gatinimittameva, na kammakammanimittāni. Yuttitopi
analyzed: ārammaṇam hoti iti daṭṭhabbam tat ca kho gati nimittam eva na kamma kamma nimittāni yuttitaḥ pi
translated: And that was the sign of the destiny, not the sign of the kamma or the sign of the rebirth-linking.🔽It is only the sign of the destiny that is logical, both on grounds of reasoning and on grounds of scripture.

original: āgamatopi gatinimittameva yujjati tathā hi tusitapureyeva setaketudevaputto hutvā
analyzed: āgamataḥ api gati nimittam eva yujjati tathā hi setaketu deva puttaḥ hutvā
translated: For it was as the god Setaketu in the Tusita heaven that the Blessed One

original: dibbagaṇanāya cattāri sahassāni, manussagaṇanāya sattapaññāsavassakoṭi,saṭṭhivassasatasahassāni🔽ṭhatvā pariyosāne pañca pubbanimittāni disvā suddhāvāse arahantabrahmunā dasahi cakkavāḷasahassehi
analyzed: dibba gaṇanāya cattāri sahassāni manussa gaṇanāya satta paññāsa vassa koṭi saṭṭhi vassa sata sahassāni  ṭhatvā pariyosāne pañca pubba nimittāni disvā suddhāvāse arahanta brahmunā dasahi cakkavāḷa sahassehi
translated: and in divine reckoning four thousand years, in human reckoning seventy-five hundred thousand years and six hundred thousand years.🔽After standing thus, he saw the five signs at the end, and then the Brahmā who was to become the Arahanta named Suddhāvāsa,

original: āgamma devatāvisesehi ca.
analyzed: āgamma devatā visesehi ca
translated: and also with the special deities from the ten thousand world systems.

original: “Kālo deva mahāvīra, uppajja mātukucchayaṃ;
analyzed: kālaḥ deva mahāvīraḥ uppajja mātukucchayam
translated: “The time has come, O Lord, Great Hero, to be conceived in your mother’s womb;

original: Sadevakaṃ tārayanto, bujjhassu amataṃ pada”nti.
analyzed: sa devakam tārayantaḥ bujjhassu amatam padanti
translated: Delivering the world with its gods, you will awaken to the Deathless State.”

original: Yāciyamāno “kālaṃ dīpañca desañca, kulaṃ mātarameva cā”ti vuttāni pañca mahāvilokanāni
analyzed: kālam dīpam ca desam ca kulam mātaram eva ca ati vuttāni pañca mahā vilokanāni
translated: When asked, he looked at the five great lookings, namely, the time, the island, the family, the mother, and the place,

analyzed: viloketvā tusita puratas cavitvā āsāḷhīpuṇṇamāyam uttarāsāḷha nakkhattena iva saddhim  ekūnavīsatiyā paṭisandhi cittesu mettā pubba bhāgamassa somanassa ñāṇa sampayutta asaṅkhārika kusala cittassa
translated: and after passing away from the Tusita heaven, he was conceived in his mother’s womb on the full-moon day of Āsāḷhi, together with the Uttarāsāḷha lunar mansion.🔽In the nineteen consciousnesses of rebirth, he took rebirth with a consciousness similar to the wholesome-resultant consciousness associated with the knowledge of joy, which is the forerunner of loving-kindness,

original: sadisena mahāvipākacittena paṭisandhiṃ aggahesi. Tadārammaṇāsannavīthito pubbabhāge
analyzed: sadisena mahā vipāka cittena paṭisandhim aggahesi tad ārammaṇa āsanna vīthitaḥ pubba bhāge
translated: and which has a great result. In the first nine of the rebirth-linking consciousnesses, which have that as their object,

original: ālokitāni kāladīpadesakulamātaravasena imāni pañca paṭisandhicittassa gatinimittārammaṇabhāvena🔽gocarabhāvaṃ gacchantīti amhākaṃ khanti tanninnatappoṇatappabbhāravasena bāhullappavattito
analyzed: ālokitāni kāla dīpa desa kula mātara vasena imāni pañca paṭisandhi cittassa gati nimitta ārammaṇa bhāvena  gocara bhāvam gacchanti iti amhākam khanti tad ninna tappoṇa tad pabbhāra vasena bāhulla ppavattito
translated: It is because of the abundance of the occurrence of the inclination, tendency, and proclivity towards them that they are called “habitual” in the Abhidhamma.

original: teneva abhidhammatthasaṅgahādīsu abhidhammattha vibhāvaniyaṃ “maraṇakāle yathārahaṃ
analyzed: tena iva abhidhamma attha saṅgaha ādīsu maraṇa kāle yathāraham
translated: That is why, in the Abhidhamma, the Abhidhammaṭṭhapana, etc., say, “At the time of death, according to the kind of death,🔽either the kamma that will generate rebirth-linking in the next becoming becomes evident, or the sign of kamma that was previously experienced at the time of its performance becomes evident, or the sign of destiny that will be experienced in the next becoming becomes evident.

original: abhimukhībhūtaṃ bhavantare paṭisandhijanakaṃ kammaṃ vā taṃ kammakaraṇakāle rūpādikamupaladdhapubbamupakaraṇabhūtañca🔽kammanimittaṃ vā anantaramuppajjamānabhave upalabhitabbaṃ upabhogabhūtaṃ gatinimittaṃ
analyzed: abhimukhībhūtam bhavantare paṭisandhi janakam kammam vā tam kamma karaṇa kāle rūpa ādikam upaladdha pubbam upakaraṇa bhūtam ca  kamma nimittam vā anantaram uppajjamāna bhave upalabhitabbam upabhoga bhūtam gati nimittam
translated: The sign of kamma is the object of the death consciousness in one who is bound for a happy destiny, and it is the object of the death consciousness in one who is bound for a miserable destiny.🔽The sign of destiny is the object of the death consciousness in one who is bound for a happy destiny, and it is the object of the death consciousness in one who is bound for a miserable destiny.🔽The sign of kamma and the sign of destiny are the objects of the death consciousness in one who is bound for a happy destiny, and they are the objects of the death consciousness in one who is bound for a miserable destiny.🔽The sign of kamma and the sign of destiny are the objects of the death consciousness in one who is bound for a happy destiny, and they are the objects of the death consciousness in one who is bound for a miserable destiny.

original: vā kammabalena channaṃ dvārānamaññatarasmiṃ paccupaṭṭhāsi, tato paraṃ tameva tathopaṭṭhitamālambaṇaṃ🔽ārabbha vipaccamānakakammānurūpaṃ parisuddhaṃ vā, upakkiliṭṭhaṃ vā upapajjitabbabhavānurūpaṃ
analyzed: vā kamma balena channam tato param tam eva tathā upaṭṭhitam ālambaṇam 🔽ārabbha vipaccamānaka kamma anurūpam parisuddham vā upakkiliṭṭham vā upapajjitabba bhava anurūpam
translated: The sign of kamma and the sign of destiny are the objects of the death consciousness in one who is bound for a happy destiny, and they are the objects of the death consciousness in one who is bound for a miserable destiny.🔽The sign of kamma and the sign of destiny are the objects of the death consciousness in one who is bound for a happy destiny, and they are the objects of the death consciousness in one who is bound for a miserable destiny.🔽The sign of kamma and the sign of destiny are the objects of the death consciousness in one who is bound for a happy destiny, and they are the objects of the death consciousness in one who is bound for a miserable destiny.🔽The sign of kamma and the sign of destiny are the objects of the death consciousness in one who is bound for a happy destiny, and they are the objects of the death consciousness in one who is bound for a miserable destiny.

original: tatthoṇataṃva cittasantānamabhiṇhaṃ pavattati bāhullena. Tameva vā pana janakabhūtaṃ
analyzed: citta santānam abhiṇham pavattati bāhullena tam eva vā pana janaka bhūtam
translated: and the state of being full of it occurs frequently in the mind-continuum. Or else,🔽

original: kammaṃ abhinavakaraṇavasena dvārappattaṃ hoti. Paccāsannamaraṇassa pana tassa vīthicittāvasāne🔽bhavaṅgakkhayevā cavanavasena paccuppannabhavapariyosānabhūtaṃ cuticittaṃ uppajjitvā
analyzed: kammam abhinava karaṇa vasena dvāra ppattam hoti pacca āsanna maraṇassa pana tassa vīthi citta avasāne  bhavaṅga khayā iva cavana vasena paccuppanna bhava pariyosāna bhūtam cuti cittam uppajjitvā
translated: and the kamma that is the cause of the rebirth-linking is called “rebirth-linking” because it causes the occurrence of the rebirth-linking consciousness.🔽The rebirth-linking consciousness arises and ceases in the cognitive series of the dying consciousness.

original: nirujjhati. Tasmiṃ niruddhāvasāne tassānantarameva tathā gahitamālambaṇamārabbha🔽savatthukamavatthukameva vā yathārahaṃ avijjānusayaparikkhittena taṇhānusayamūlakena🔽saṅkhārena janiyamānaṃ sampayuttehi pariggayhamānaṃ sahajātānamadhiṭṭhānabhāvena
analyzed: nirujjhati tasmin niruddha avasāne tassa anantaram eva tathā gahitam ālambaṇam ārabbha  sa vatthukam avatthukam eva vā yathāraham avijjā anusaya parikkhittena taṇhā anusaya mūlakena  saṅkhārena janiyamānam sampayuttehi pariggayhamānam sahajātānam adhiṭṭhāna bhāvena
translated: Immediately next to it, that is, immediately next to the cessation of the rebirth-linking consciousness, there arises the mind called “rebirth-linking” in the next becoming.🔽This is the same as the object that was apprehended by the rebirth-linking consciousness.🔽It is generated by formations rooted in the underlying tendency to craving, which are surrounded by the underlying tendency to ignorance.

original: pubbaṅgamabhūtaṃ bhavantarapaṭisandhānavasena paṭisandhisaṅkhātaṃ mānasamuppajjamānameva
analyzed: pubbaṅgam abhūtam bhava antara paṭisandhāna vasena paṭisandhi saṅkhātam mānasam uppajjamānam eva
translated: It is accompanied by the associated states. It is directed by the volition that is the forerunner.🔽It occurs as rebirth-linking in the next becoming.

original: patiṭṭhāti bhavantare”ti vuttaṃ. Tattha “tatthoṇataṃva cittasantānamabhiṇhaṃ pavattati
analyzed: patiṭṭhāti bhavantare iti vuttam citta santānam abhiṇham pavattati
translated: “The rebirth-linking consciousness occurs in the next becoming” means that it occurs and is established in the next becoming.

original: bāhullenā”ti iminā kammabalena upaṭṭhitaṃ gatinimittaṃ maraṇāsannavīthito pubbe ekāhadvīhādivasena
analyzed: bāhullena ati iminā kamma balena upaṭṭhitam gati nimittam maraṇa āsanna vīthitaḥ pubbe ekāha dvīha ādi vasena
translated: “By the power of kamma” means the sign of the destiny that is established by the power of kamma. Before the time of the death-bed, for one day, two days, or three days,

original: sattāhampi, sattāhato uttaripi uppajjate vāti dasseti tathā hi parisuddhaṃ vā upakkiliṭṭhaṃ
analyzed: sattāham pi sattāhato uttari pi uppajjate vā ati dasseti tathā hi parisuddham vā upakkiliṭṭham
translated: “By the power of kamma-formation” shows that the sign of destiny, which is supported by the kamma-formation, arises even before the time of the death-bed, for one, two, three, four, five, six, or seven days, or even more than seven days.

original: vā vipaccamānakakammānurūpaṃ gatinimittaṃ cirakālampi tiṭṭhati, ariyagālatissacoraghātakādayo🔽viya tathā hi ariyagālatisso nāma upāsako sīhaḷadīpe attano bhariyāya sumanāya saddhiṃ
analyzed: vā vipaccamānaka kamma anurūpam gati nimittam cira kālam pi tiṭṭhati ariya gāla tissa cora ghātaka ādayo  viya tathā hi ariyagālatissaḥ nāma upāsako sīhaḷadīpe bhariyāya sumanāya saddhiṃ
translated: For the sign of destiny, which is ripening according to the kamma that is ripening, may last a long time, whether it is clear or obscure.🔽For example, the lay devotee Ariya-Gutta-Tissa, the murderer of the robber Gutta,🔽For the lay devotee Ariya-Gutta-Tissa, who lived in the island of Sri Lanka, made meritorious deeds such as giving gifts, etc., together with his wife Sumana,

original: yāvajīvaṃ dānādi puññakammāni katvā āyūhapariyosāne ariyagālatissassa maraṇamañce🔽nipannassa chadevalokato rathaṃ ānetvā attano attano devalokaṃ vaṇṇesuṃ. Upāsako
analyzed: yāvajīvam dāna ādi puñña kammāni katvā āyūha pariyosāne ariyagāla tissassa maraṇa mañce  nipannassa cha deva lokataḥ ratham ānetvā attanaḥ attanaḥ deva lokam vaṇṇesuṃ upāsakaḥ
translated: until the end of his life. At the end of his life, when Ariya-Gutta-Tissa was lying on his death-bed,🔽six gods brought a chariot from the god-realms and showed it to him. The lay devotee,

original: devatānaṃ kathaṃ sutvā tusitapurato āhaṭarathaṃ ṭhapetvā avasesarathe “gahetvā gacchathā”ti
analyzed: devatānam katham sutvā tusita puratas āhaṭa ratham ṭhapetvā avasesa rathe gahetvā gacchatha ati
translated: having heard the gods’ words, stopped the chariot that had been brought from the Tusita god-realm, and said: “Take the other chariots and go.”

original: āha. Sumanā pana attano sāmikassa vacanaṃ sutvā “kiṃ tissa maraṇāsanne vilāpaṃ akāsī”ti🔽āha. Tisso attano bhariyāya kathaṃ sutvā āha… “ahaṃ vilāpaṃ na karomi, devalokato
analyzed: āha sumanā pana attanaḥ sāmikassa vacanam sutvā kim tissa maraṇa āsanne vilāpam akāsi iti  āha tissaḥ attanaḥ bhariyāya katham sutvā āha aham vilāpam na karomi deva lokataḥ
translated: “She wept.” “And what did he do when he heard his wife weeping?”🔽“I did not weep,” he said. “But when I was dying, six chariots came from the world of the gods. I talked with those goddesses.”

original: devatā cha rathe ānesuṃ tāhi devatāhi saddhaṃ kathemī”ti. Taṃ napassāmi kuhi”nti
analyzed: devatā cha rathe ānesum tāhi devatāhi saddham kathemi iti tam na passāmi kuhin ti
translated: “I do not see them. Where are they?”🔽When this was said, he had a garland of flowers brought and threw it into the air.

original: vutte pupphadāmaṃ āharāpetvā ākāse khipāpesi. Sā taṃ pupphadāmaṃ rathasīse olambamānaṃ
analyzed: vutte puppha dāmam āharāpetvā ākāse khipāpesi sā tam puppha dāmam ratha sīse olambamānam
translated: She saw the garland hanging from the front of the chariot,

original: disvā gabbhaṃ pavisitvā sayane sayitvā nāsikavātaṃ sannirujjhitvā cavitvā pāturahosi.
analyzed: disvā gabbham pavisitvā sayane sayitvā nāsika vātam san nirujjhitvā cavitvā pātuḥ ahosi
translated: entered her house, lay down on her bed, stopped breathing through her nose, and died.

original: Sā attano sāmikassa sāsanaṃ pesesi… “ahaṃ pana paṭhamaṃ āgatomhi, tvaṃ kasmā cirāyasī”ti.
analyzed: sā attanaḥ sāmikassa sāsanam pesesi aham pana paṭhamam āgataḥ amhi tvam kasmā cirāyasi iti
translated: She sent a message to her husband: “I was the first to come. Why did you tarry so long?”🔽They both got into the chariots and went to the Tusita heaven,

original: Ubhopi rathe ṭhatvā sabbe olokentānaṃyeva tusitapuraṃ agamaṃsu. Imasmiñhi vatthusmiṃ
analyzed: ubho api rathe ṭhatvā sabbe tusitapuram agamaṃsu imasmin hi vatthusmin
translated: where they were seen by all. In this story,🔽the sign of the husband’s rebirth became clear to his wife. She was reborn first in the Tusita heaven,

original: sāmikassa upaṭṭhitagatinimittaṃ bhariyāya pākaṭaṃ hutvā puretaratusitapure nibbattitvā
analyzed: sāmikassa upaṭṭhita gati nimittam bhariyāya pākaṭam hutvā puretara tusita pure nibbattitvā
translated: and then

original: sāmikassa sāsanaṃ pesesi tena ariyagālatissassa cirakālaṃ gatinimittaṃ upaṭṭhātīti
analyzed: sāmikassa sāsanam pesesi tena ariyagāla tissassa cira kālam gati nimittam upaṭṭhāti iti
translated: and sent a message to her husband. It should be understood that the sign of the destination appeared to Ariya Dēvatissā for a long time.

original: veditabbaṃ. Manussaloke hi cirakālaṃ tusitapure muhuttaṃva hoti. Evaṃ parisuddhaṃ
analyzed: veditabbam manussa loke hi cira kālam tusitapure muhuttam va hoti evam parisuddham
translated: For in the world of men a long time is like a moment in the Tusita heaven.

original: vipaccamānakakammānurūpaṃ gatinimittaṃ cirakālaṃ pavattati iminā nayena duṭṭhagāmaṇiabhayadhammikaupsakādīnampi🔽vatthu vitthāretabbaṃ. Coraghātakassa pana mahāniraye vipaccamānakakammānurūpaṃ nerayaggijālādikaṃ
analyzed: vipaccamānaka kamma anurūpam gati nimittam cira kālam pavattati iminā nayena duṭṭha gāmaṇi abhaya dhammikaupsaka ādīnam pi  vatthu vitthāretabbam cora ghātakassa pana mahāniraye vipaccamānaka kamma anurūpam
translated: This is how the sign of the destination appears for a long time in accordance with the ripening of the kamma. In this way the stories of Duṭṭhagāmani, Abhaya, Dhammarakkhita, and Upagu should be elaborated.

original: sattāhaṃ upaṭṭhāti. Sāvatthinagare kira pañcasatā corā bahinagare corakammaṃ karonti.🔽Athekadivasaṃ janapadapuriso tesaṃ abbhantaro hutvā corakammaṃ akāsi, tadā te sabbepi
analyzed: satta aham upaṭṭhāti sāvatthi nagare kira pañca satā corāḥ bahi nagare cora kammam karonti  atha eka divasam janapada puriso tesam abbhantaraḥ hutvā cora kammam akāsi tadā te sabbe pi
translated: But for the murderer of the thief the sign of the destination appears in the Great Hell for seven days in accordance with the ripening of the kamma. For example, it is said that once in the city of Sāvatthī five hundred thieves were committing robberies outside the city.🔽One day a man from the country joined them and took part in the robbery. Then all of them🔽were caught by the king’s men. When the king saw them he said, “Kill all these thieves and give their goods to their captors.”

original: rājapurisā aggahesuṃ. Rājā te disvā “tumhākaṃ antare ime sabbe māretuṃ samatthassa
analyzed: rāja purisāḥ aggahesum rājā te disvā tumhākam antare ime sabbe māretum samatthassa
translated: “Very well, sire,” they replied.

original: jīvitaṃ dammī”ti āha. Pañcasatā corā aññamaññaṃ sambandhā aññamaññaṃ sahāyakāti aññamaññaṃ
analyzed: jīvitam dammi iti āha pañca satā corāḥ aññam aññam sambandhāḥ aññam aññam sahāyakāḥ ati aññam aññam
translated: “I give you my life.” The five hundred thieves, being related to each other, being friends to each other,🔽

original: māretuṃ na icchiṃsu, janapadamanusso pana “ahaṃ māremī”ti vatvā sabbe māresi. Rājā
analyzed: māretum na icchiṃsu janapada manussaḥ pana aham māremi iti vatvā sabbe māresi rājā
translated: and he said, “I give you your life.” The five hundred thieves were related to one another and were friends, and so they did not want to kill one another. But a man of the country said, “I will kill,” and he killed them all. The king

original: tassa tussitvā coraghātakakammaṃ adāsi. So pañcavīsativassāni coraghātakakammaṃ ākāsi.
analyzed: tassa tussitvā cora ghātaka kammam adāsi saḥ pañcavīsati vassāni cora ghātaka kammam ākāsi
translated: was pleased with him and gave him the office of executioner. He served as executioner for twenty-five years.

original: Rājā tassa mahallakoti vatvā aññassa coraghātaka kammaṃ dāpesi. So coraghātakakammā🔽apanīto aññatarassa santike nāsikavātaṃ uggaṇhitvā hatthapādakaṇṇanāsādīhi chinditabbānaṃ
analyzed: rājā tassa mahallakaḥ iti vatvā aññassa kammam dāpesi saḥ cora ghātaka kammā  apanītaḥ aññatarassa santike nāsika vātam uggaṇhitvā hattha pāda kaṇṇa nāsā ādīhi chinditabbānam
translated: The king said that he was too old and gave the office to another. He was removed from the office of executioner

original: ūrūthanakaṭṭhānaṃ bhindantamāretabbayuttānaṃ nāsikavātaṃ vissajjetvā māretabbaṃ mantaṃ
analyzed: ūrūthanaka ṭṭhānam bhindantam āretabba yuttānam nāsika vātam vissajjetvā māretabbam mantam
translated: and learned the art of killing by means of the breath from the nose from another. He was given a spell to kill by means of the breath from the nose those who were to be cut up with the hands, feet, ears, nose, etc.,

original: labhi. So rājānaṃ ārocetvā nāsikavātena coraghātakakammaṃ karontasseva tiṃsa vassāni
analyzed: saḥ rājānam ārocetvā nāsika vātena cora ghātaka kammam karontassa iva tiṃsa vassāni
translated: and those who were to be killed by breaking their thighs and knees. He informed the king and killed by means of the breath from the nose those who were to be executed for thirty years.

original: atikkami. So pacchā mahallako hutvā maraṇamañce nipajji “sattadivasena kālaṃ karissatī”ti.
analyzed: atikkami saḥ pacchā mahallakaḥ hutvā maraṇa mañce nipajji satta divasena kālam karissati iti
translated: Later, when he was old, he lay down on his deathbed, and it was said that he would die in seven days.

original: Maraṇakāle mahantaṃ vedanaṃ ahosi. So mahāniraye nibbatto viya mahāsaddaṃ katvā dukkhito
analyzed: maraṇa kāle mahantam vedanam ahosi saḥ mahāniraye nibbattaḥ viya mahā saddam katvā dukkhitaḥ
translated: At the moment of death he suffered great pain. He was reborn in the Great Hell, and he cried out with a great cry of pain.

original: hoti. Tassa saddena bhītā manussā ubhatopasse gehaṃ chaḍḍetvā palāyiṃsu. Tassa maraṇadivase
analyzed: hoti tassa saddena bhītāḥ manussāḥ ubhatopasse geham chaḍḍetvā palāyiṃsu tassa maraṇa divase
translated: The people were frightened by the sound, and they left their houses on both sides of the road and fled. On the day of his death

original: sāriputtatthero dibbacakkhunā lokaṃ olokento etassa kālaṃ katvā mahāniraye nibbattamānaṃ
analyzed: sāriputta theraḥ dibba cakkhunā lokaṃ olokento etassa kālam katvā mahāniraye nibbattamānam
translated: the Elder Sāriputta was looking down upon the world with his deva eye. He saw that this man had died and was reborn in the Great Hell.

original: disvā tassa anukampaṃ paṭicca gehadvāre pākaṭo ahosi. So kujjhitvā nāsikavātaṃ vissajjesi.
analyzed: disvā tassa anukampam paṭicca geha dvāre pākaṭaḥ ahosi saḥ kujjhitvā nāsika vātam vissajjesi
translated: Out of compassion for him, he appeared at the door of the house. The man was angry and he breathed out through his nose.

original: Yāva tatiyaṃ vissajjamānopi vissajjāpetuṃ asakkonto theraṃ atirekena virocamānaṃ🔽disvā cittaṃ pasādetvā pāyāsaṃ therassa dāpesi. Thero maṅgalaṃ vaḍḍhetvā agamāsi.
analyzed: yāva tatiyam vissajjamānaḥ api vissajjāpetum a sakkontaḥ theram atirekena virocamānam  disvā cittam pasādetvā pāyāsam therassa dāpesi theraḥ maṅgalam vaḍḍhetvā agamāsi
translated: Even when he breathed out three times, he was unable to blow the Elder away. Instead, he saw the Elder shining more brightly than ever.🔽He was pleased with the Elder, and he had rice gruel given to him. The Elder increased the auspiciousness and went away.

original: Coraghātako therassa dinnadānaṃ anussaritvā cavitvā sagge nibbatti, nirayajālādayo
analyzed: cora ghātakaḥ therassa dinna dānam anussaritvā cavitvā sagge nibbatti niraya jāla ādayaḥ
translated: The man who had killed the thief remembered the gift he had given to the Elder. When he died, he was reborn in heaven, and the net of the hells and the rest

original: antaradhāyanti. So anāgatepi paccekabuddho bhavissati. Evaṃ upakkiliṭṭhaṃ vā vipaccamāna
analyzed: antaradhāyanti saḥ anāgate pi paccekabuddhaḥ bhavissati evam upakkiliṭṭham vā vipaccamāna
translated: disappeared. He will be a Paccekabuddha in the future. Thus, when the result is ripening, even a gift that is defiled

original: kakammānurūpaṃ gatinimittampi sattāhaparamaṃ upaṭṭhāti. Atthikehi pana sahassavatthu🔽sagāthāvaggesu oloketabbo. Bhagavato pana parisuddhaṃ mettāpubbabhāgassa somanassa
analyzed: ka kamma anurūpam gati nimittam pi satta aha paramam upaṭṭhāti atthikehi pana sahassa vatthu  sa gāthā vaggesu oloketabbaḥ bhagavataḥ pana parisuddham mettā pubbabhāgassa somanassa
translated: The sign of the destiny in accordance with the kind of kamma lasts at most a week. But if there is a need for it, it can be looked at in the Thousand,🔽in the Collection of Verses, and in the Collection of Birth Stories.🔽But in the case of the Blessed One, these five signs of destiny, namely, the sign of time, the sign of the direction, the sign of the country, the sign of the family, and the sign of the mother,

original: ñāṇasampayuttakusalassa kammassa vegena kāladīpadesakulamātaravasena imāni pañcagatinimittāni
analyzed: ñāṇa sampayutta kusalassa kammassa vegena kāla dīpa desa kula mātara vasena imāni pañca gati nimittāni
translated: appeared for a long time, owing to the speed of the profitable kamma consisting of the knowledge associated with the joy that was the forerunner of the purification of his mind.

original: cirakālaṃ hutvā upaṭṭhahanti. Cirakālanti manussaloke sattāhamattaṃ, tusitapuremuhuttameva,
analyzed: cirakālam hutvā upaṭṭhahanti manussa loke satta aha mattam tusita pure muhuttam eva
translated: The long time was a week in the human world, and only a moment in the Tusita heaven.

original: tathāpi manussaloke sattāhamatte kāle devatānaṃ pañcapubbanimittāni paññāyanti tañca
analyzed: tathā api manussa loke satta aha matte kāle devatānam pañca pubba nimittāni paññāyanti tat ca
translated: But even so, in the human world, after a week, five signs appeared to deities,

original: kho puññavantānaṃyeva paññāyanti, na sabbesaṃ manussaloke puññavantānaṃ rājarājamahāmattādīnaṃ
analyzed: kho puññavantānam yeva paññāyanti na sabbesam manussa loke puññavantānam rāja rāja mahāmatta ādīnam
translated: and they appeared only to those who were meritorious, not to all the meritorious people in the human world, as they did to kings, royal ministers, and so on.

original: viya taṃ disvā mahesakkhā devatā jānanti, na appesakkhā, manussaloke nemittakā brāhmaṇapaṇḍitādayoviya.
analyzed: viya tam disvā mahesakkhāḥ devatāḥ jānanti na appesakkhāḥ manussa loke nemittakāḥ brāhmaṇa paṇḍita ādayaḥ viya
translated: Deities of great influence know them, not those of little influence, just as in the human world learned brahmans and so on are diviners.

original: Mahesakkhā devatā taṃ pubbanimittaṃ disvā nandavanaṃ netvā “kālo devā”ti ādīhi yācanti.
analyzed: mahesakkhā devatā tam pubba nimittam disvā nandavanam netvā kālaḥ deva ati ādīhi yācanti
translated: The deities of great power, seeing this as a sign, led him to the Nandana Grove and requested him to come down with the words, “The time has come, Lord.”

original: Mahāsakko tattheva nandavanuyyāne kāladīpadesakulamātaravasena pañca viloketvā cavitvā
analyzed: mahā sakko tattha iva nanda vana uyyāne kāladīpa desa kula mātara vasena pañca cavitvā
translated: Then Mahāsaṅkhapura, looking at the time, the place, the country, the family, and the mother, died.

original: tamārammaṇaṃ katvā mahāmāyāya kucchimhi paṭisandhiṃ aggahesīti sanniṭṭhānamavagantabbaṃ.🔽Tattha kālanti manussaloke ekūnatiṃsatime vasse vesākhapuṇṇamadivase buddho bhavissāmīti
analyzed: tam ārammaṇam katvā mahāmāyāya kucchimhi paṭisandhim aggahesi iti sanniṭṭhānam avagantabbam  tattha manussa loke ekūnatiṃsatime vasse vesākha puṇṇama divase buddhaḥ bhavissāmi iti
translated: It should be understood that he took rebirth in the womb of Mahāmāyā, making her his object.🔽Herein, the time was that he looked at the time, thinking, “I shall become a Buddha on the full-moon day of the month of Āsāḷhi, when the human life span is a hundred years.”

original: kālaṃ olokesi. Dīpanti jambudīpeyeva bhavissāmi, na aññadīpesūti dīpaṃ olokesi. Desanti
analyzed: kālam olokesi dīpanti jambudīpeya iva bhavissāmi na añña dīpesu ti dīpam olokesi desanti
translated: The place was that he looked at the place, thinking, “I shall become a Buddha in the Rose-Apple Island, not in another island.” The country was that

original: majjhimadeseyeva, tañca kho mahābodhimaṇḍeyeva, na aññadeseti desaṃ olokesi. Kulanti🔽dve kulāni khattiyakulabrāhmaṇakulavasena. Tattha yasmiṃ kāle khattiyakulaṃ loke
analyzed: majjhima deseyā iva tat ca kho mahā bodhimaṇḍeyā iva na añña deseti desam olokesi kulam ti  dve kulāni khattiya kula brāhmaṇa kula vasena yasmin kāle khattiya kulam loke
translated: he looked at the country, thinking, “I shall become a Buddha in the Middle Country, and there too in the vicinity of the Great Bodhi Tree, not in another country.” The family was that

original: seṭṭhabhāvena “ayameva loke aggo”ti sammannati, tadā khattiyakuleyeva buddhā uppajjanti.
analyzed: seṭṭha bhāvena ayam eva loke aggaḥ ti sammannati tadā khattiya kuleya iva buddhāḥ uppajjanti
translated: there are two families, the warrior-noble family and the brāhmaṇa family. Herein, when at a certain time the warrior-noble family is recognized as the best in the world, then Buddhas appear only in that family,🔽not in any other. And when at a certain time the brāhmaṇa family is recognized as the best in the world, then Buddhas appear only in that family, not in any other.

original: Yasmiṃ pana kāle brāhmaṇakulaṃ ayameva loke aggoti, tadā brāhmaṇakuleyeva buddhā🔽uppajjanti. Idāni pana khattiyakulameva aggoti sammannanti. Khattiyakulepi sakyarājānova
analyzed: yasmin pana kāle brāhmaṇa kulam ayam eva loke tadā brāhmaṇa kuleyā iva buddhā  uppajjanti idāni pana khattiya kulam eva aggo ti sammannanti khattiya kule pi sakya rājānaḥ uva
translated: But when the time came for the brahmin clan to be the highest in the world, then Buddhas arose only in brahmin clans.🔽Now they agree that only the warrior clan is the highest. And in the warrior clan the Sakyan king is the highest in the world,

original: loke uttamā, asambhinnakhattiyakulattā tasmā sakyarājakuleyeva bhavissāmīti kulaṃ
analyzed: loke uttamā a sambhinna khattiya kula ttā tasmā sakya rāja kuleyā iva bhavissāmi iti kulam
translated: because his warrior clan is unadulterated. So he looked to see in which Sakyan clan he would be reborn.

original: olokesi. Mātaranti mama mātaraṃ dasa māsāni satta ca divasāni ṭhassati, etthantare
analyzed: olokesi mātaranti mama mātaram dasa māsāni satta ca divasāni etthantare
translated: ‘Mother’: my mother will live for ten months and seven days; in the interval

original: mama mātuyā arogo bhavissatīti mātarampi olokesi. Bodhisattamātā pana pacchimavaye🔽ṭhitā. Evaṃ yuttitopi āgamatopi bhagavato nibbānacittassa paṭasandhicittena gahitanimittameva
analyzed: mama mātuyāḥ arogaḥ bhavissati iti mātaram pi olokesi bodhisatta mātā pana pacchima vaye  ṭhitāḥ evam yuttitaḥ pi āgamataḥ pi bhagavataḥ nibbāna cittassa paṭa sandhi cittena gahita nimittam eva
translated: she will be healthy. So he looked to see in which mother he would be reborn. But the Bodhisatta’s mother is one who has reached her last incarnation

original: ārammaṇaṃ hotīti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: ārammaṇam hoti iti veditabbam
translated: and is in her last existence. So it should be understood that the object of the Blessed One’s consciousness of attaining Nibbāna is the same as that apprehended by the consciousness of the threshold of the fine-material sphere, both according to the method and according to the texts.🔽The field of the Blessed One’s consciousness of Nibbāna,

original: Sabbaññujinanibbāna, cittassa gocaraṃ subhaṃ;
analyzed: sabbaññu jina nibbāna cittassa gocaram subham
translated: Which is the field of the Omniscient Conqueror, is fair.🔽The sign of the destination should be understood

original: Viññeyyaṃ gatinimittaṃ, ganthehi avirodhato.
analyzed: viññeyyam gati nimittam ganthehi avirodhato
translated: As the object of the consciousness of one who goes, since there is no contradiction.

original: Dhātuparinibbānampi bodhimaṇḍeyeva bhavissati vuttañhetaṃ uparipaṇṇāsake “dhātuparinibbānaṃ
analyzed: dhātu parinibbānam pi bodhimaṇḍeya iva bhavissati vuttam ha etam upari paṇṇāsake dhātu parinibbānam
translated: The parinibbāna of the elements will also be at the Bodhi Tree. For this is said in the last section:

original: anāgate bhavissati sāsanassa hi osakkanakāle imasmiṃ tambapaṇṇidīpe dhātuyo sannipatitvā🔽mahācetiyato nāgadīpe rājāyatanacetiyaṃ, tato mahābodhipallaṅkaṃ gamissanti. Nāgabhavanatopi
analyzed: anāgate bhavissati sāsanassa hi osakkana kāle imasmin tambapaṇṇidīpe dhātuyaḥ sannipatitvā  mahācetiyataḥ nāgadīpe rāja āyatana cetiyam tatas mahā bodhipallaṅkam gamissanti nāga bhavanataḥ pi
translated: The Parinibbāna of the Relics will also take place at the Bodhi Tree. For this is said in the last section of the Mahā Parinibbāna Sutta: “In the future, when the Dispensation is disappearing, the relics will assemble in this Island of Tambapaṇṇi,🔽and from the Great Shrine they will go to the Rājagaha Shrine in the Nāga realm, and from there to the Great Bodhi Tree.

original: devalokatopi dhātuyo mahābodhipallaṅkameva gamissanti sāsapamattāpi dhātuyo antarā
analyzed: deva lokataḥ api dhātuyaḥ mahā bodhi pallaṅkam eva gamissanti sāsapa mattāḥ api dhātuyaḥ antarā
translated: And from the Nāga realm and from the deva world the relics will go to the Great Bodhi Tree. Even relics the size of a mustard seed will not be lost on the way.

original: na nassissanti, sabbā dhātuyo mahābodhipallaṅke rāsibhūtā suvaṇṇakkhandhā viya ekagghanā
analyzed: na sabbāḥ dhātuyaḥ mahā bodhi pallaṅke rāsi bhūtā suvaṇṇa kkhandhā viya ekagghanā
translated: All the relics will gather at the Great Bodhi Tree like a heap of gold. They will be of the same value as a mass of gold.

original: hutvā chabbaṇṇarasmiyo vissajjissanti, tā dasasahassalokadhātuṃ pharissanti. Tato🔽dasasahassacakkavāḷesu devatā sannipatitvā ''ajja satthā parinibbāyati ajja sāsanaṃ
analyzed: hutvā chabbaṇṇa rasmiyaḥ vissajjissanti tāḥ dasa sahassa lokadhātum pharissanti tatas  dasa sahassa cakkavāḷesu devatā sannipatitvā ajja satthā parinibbāyati ajja sāsanam
translated: They will burn and emit six-coloured rays, which will spread through the ten-thousand world system.

original: osakkati pacchimadassanaṃ idaṃ amhāka”nti dasabalassa parinibbutadivasato mahantataraṃ
analyzed: osakkati pacchima dassanam idam amhākam ti dasabalassa parinibbuta divasataḥ mahantataram
translated: Then the devas of the ten-thousand world system will assemble and say: ‘Today the Teacher will attain the Parinibbāna. Today the Dispensation will disappear. This is our last glimpse of him.’ And they will make a greater festival than on the day of the Buddha’s Parinibbāna.

original: kāruññaṃ karissanti ṭhapetvā anāgāmikhīṇāsave avasesā sakattabhāvena sandhāretuṃ🔽nāsakkhiṃsu, dhātusarīrato tejodhātu uṭṭhahitvā yāva brahmalokā uggacchissati. Sāsapamattāyapi🔽dhātuyā sati ekajālā bhavissati dhātūsu pariyādānaṃ gatāsu pacchijjissati. Evaṃ mahantaṃ🔽ānubhāvaṃ dassetvā dhātūsu antarahitāsu sāsanaṃ antarahitaṃ nāma hoti. Yāva evaṃ🔽na antaradhāyati, tāva anantaradhānameva sāsanaṃ. Parinibbānakālato paṭṭhāya yāva🔽sāsapamattā dhātu tiṭṭhati, tāva buddhakālato pacchāti na veditabbaṃ dhātūsu hi ṭhitāsu
analyzed: kāruññam karissanti ṭhapetvā anāgāmi khīṇāsave avasesā sakatta bhāvena sandhāretum  na asakkhiṃsu dhātu sarīrato tejodhātu uṭṭhahitvā yāva brahmalokā uggacchissati  dhātuyā sati ekajālā bhavissati dhātūsu pariyādānam gatāsu pacchijjissati evam mahantam  ānubhāvam dassetvā dhātūsu antarahitāsu sāsanam antarahitam nāma hoti yāva evam  na antaradhāyati tāva an antaradhānam eva sāsanam parinibbāna kālato paṭṭhāya yāva  sāsapa mattā dhātu tiṭṭhati tāva buddha kālato pacchā ati na veditabbam dhātūsu hi ṭhitāsu
translated: except for the non-returners and the perfected ones, will be unable to bear their own bodies,

original: buddhā ṭhitā va honti, tasmā etthantare aññassa buddhassa uppatti nivāritāva hoti. Teneva vadāma.
analyzed: buddhāḥ ṭhitāḥ va honti tasmai etthantare aññassa buddhassa uppatti nivāritā ava hoti tena iva vadāma
translated: and the fire-element will arise in their bodies and will rise up as far as the Brahmā-world. As long as there is even a mustard seed’s worth of the element, there will be a single net of flames; when the elements are exhausted, it will be extinguished. Having thus shown its great power, when the elements have disappeared, the Dispensation is said to have disappeared. As long as it does not disappear in this way, the Dispensation is not disappeared. From the time of the Parinibbāna until the time when even a mustard seed’s worth of the element remains, it should not be understood that it is after the time of the Buddha. For as long as the elements remain, the Buddhas remain. Therefore the arising of another Buddha during this period is prevented. Therefore we say:

original: Parinibbānakālato, pacchā dharanti dhātuyo;
analyzed: parinibbāna kālato pacchā dharanti dhātuyaḥ
translated: After the Parinibbāna, the elements remain;

original: Anibbutova sambuddho, aññabuddhassa vāritā.
analyzed: a nibbutaḥ iva sambuddhaḥ aññabuddhassa vāritā
translated: The Perfect Sambuddha was not pleased, And he forbade the other Buddhas.

original: Jīvamānepi sambuddhe, nibbute vā tathāgate;
analyzed: jīvamāne api sambuddhe nibbute vā tathāgate
translated: Whether the Perfect Sambuddha lives, Or whether the Tathāgata is extinct,

original: Yo karoti samaṃ pūjaṃ, phalaṃ tāsa samaṃ siyā’ti.
analyzed: yaḥ karoti samam pūjam phalam samam siyāti
translated: He who makes equal worship Will have an equal fruit.’

original: Iti sāgarabuddhittheravicarite sīmavisodhane dhammavaṇṇanāya
analyzed: iti sāgarabuddhitthera vicarite sīmavisodhane dhamma vaṇṇanāya
translated: Thus in the Dhamma exposition in the Purification of the Boundaries, Composed by the Elder Sāgarabuddhi,🔽The Section on Nibbāna is the third chapter.

original: Nibbānakaṇḍo tatiyo paricchedo.🔽4. Samasīsikaṇḍo🔽Idāni saṅgho ca dullabho loketi padassa vaṇṇanākkamo sampatto. Tattha saṅghoti paramatthasammutivasena🔽duvidho hoti. Tesu paramatthasaṅgho cattāri purisayugāni, aṭṭhapurisapuggalā, cattālīsampi🔽puggalā, aṭṭhasatampi purisapuggalāti catubbidho hoti. Tattha saṅkhepavasena sotāpattimaggaṭṭho
analyzed: nibbāna kaṇḍaḥ tatiyaḥ paricchedo  sama sīsi kaṇḍo  idāni saṅgho ca dullabhaḥ loke ti padassa vaṇṇanā kkamaḥ sampatto tattha saṅghaḥ ti paramattha sammuti vasena  duvidhaḥ hoti tesu paramattha saṅgho cattāri purisa yugāni aṭṭha purisa puggalā cattālīsam pi  puggalāḥ aṭṭhasatam pi purisa puggalā ti catubbidhaḥ hoti tattha saṅkhepa vasena sotāpatti magga ṭṭho
translated: The Chapter on the Head-Washing Robe

original: phalaṭṭhoti ekaṃ yugaṃ, sakadāmimaggaṭṭho phalaṭṭhoti ekaṃ, anāgāmimaggaṭṭho phalaṭṭhoti
analyzed: phala ṭṭho ti ekam yugam sakadāmi magga ṭṭho phala ṭṭho ti ekam anāgāmi magga ṭṭho phala ṭṭho ti
translated: Now the turn has come to comment on the words, “The Saṅgha is hard to find in the world,” etc. Herein, the Saṅgha is twofold, according to the ultimate or the conventional truth. Of these, the ultimate Saṅgha is fourfold, according to the four pairs of men, the eight individual persons, the forty persons, and the eight hundred persons. Herein, in brief, the pair consisting of the one on the path of stream-entry and the one on the fruition of stream-entry is one pair; the pair consisting of the one on the path of once-return and the one on the fruition of once-return is one pair; the pair consisting of the one on the path of non-return and the one on the fruition of non-return is one pair; the pair consisting of the one on the path of Arahantship and the one on the fruition of Arahantship is one pair. These are the four pairs of men. The eight individual persons are the four pairs taken in order: the one on the path of stream-entry, the one on the fruition of stream-entry, the one on the path of once-return, the one on the fruition of once-return, the one on the path of non-return, the one on the fruition of non-return, the one on the path of Arahantship, and the one on the fruition of Arahantship. These are the eight individual persons. The forty persons are the eight individual persons taken in each of the five continents: in this Rose-Apple Island, in the Eastern Wine-drinking Continent, in the Western Cattle-feeding Continent, in the Northern Bear Continent, and in the Southern Wonder-working Continent. These are the forty persons. The eight hundred persons are the forty persons taken in each of the twenty parts of the world: in the Rose-Apple Continent, the Great Salt Ocean, the Moon, the Sun, the Himalaya, the Yugandhara, the Great Meru,

original: ekaṃ, arahattamaggaṭṭho phalaṭṭhoti ekanti cattāri purisayugāni honti. Cattāro maggaṭṭhā🔽cattāro phalaṭṭhāti aṭṭhapurisapuggalā honti. Cattālīsampi puggalāti sotāpattimaggaṭṭho
analyzed: ekam phala ṭṭho ti ekam ti cattāri purisa yugāni honti cattāraḥ magga ṭṭhā  cattāro phala ṭṭhā ati aṭṭha purisa puggalāḥ honti cattālīsam pi puggalā ati sotāpatti magga ṭṭho
translated: One is the one who is a path-attainer and a fruition-attainer. So there are four pairs of persons. There are four who are path-attainers,

original: paṭhamajhānikādivasena pañca, tathā sakadāgāmianāgāmiarahattamaggaṭṭhāpi pañca pañcāti🔽vīsati maggaṭṭhapuggalā, tathā phalaṭṭhāpi sotapattiphalaṭṭhādivasena pañca pañcāti
analyzed: paṭhama jhānikā ādi vasena pañca tathā sakadāgāmi anāgāmi arahatta magga ṭṭhā api pañca pañca ati  vīsati magga ṭṭha puggalā tathā phalaṭṭhā api sota patti phalaṭṭha ādi vasena pañca pañca ati
translated: four who are fruition-attainers, making eight persons. There are also forty persons. The one who is a stream-enterer by way of the path of stream-entry is one of the five who are of the first jhana. Likewise the one who is a once-returner by way of the path of once-return, the non-returner by way of the path of non-return, and the Arahant by way of the path of Arahantship are each one of the five who are of the first jhana.🔽So there are twenty persons who are path-attainers. Likewise there are twenty persons who are fruition-attainers, the one who is a stream-enterer by way of the fruition of stream-entry being one of the five who are of the first jhana, and so on.

original: vīsati phalaṭṭhāti cattālīsapuggalā honti. Ettha ca maggassa ekacittakkhaṇikattā
analyzed: vīsati cattālīsa puggalāḥ honti ettha ca maggassa eka citta khaṇika ttā
translated: So there are forty persons. But since the path is of one moment only,

original: kathaṃ vīsatimaggaṭṭhā puggalā bhaveyyunti.
analyzed: katham vīsati magga ṭṭhāḥ puggalāḥ bhaveyyun ti
translated: how can there be twenty persons who are path-attainers?

original: Vuccatepādakajjhānasammasitajjhānapuggalajjhāsayesupi hi aññataravasena taṃ taṃ jhānasadisavitakkādiaṅgapātubhāvena
analyzed: hi aññatara vasena tam tam jhāna sadisa vitakka ādi aṅga pātubhāvena
translated: It may be said that they are so called because they are respectively of the first jhana, etc., in the sense of the jhana that is the basis for the path, in the sense of the jhana that is the proximate cause for the path, and in the sense of the jhana that is the object of the path.

original: cattāropi maggaṭṭhā paṭhamajjhānikādivohāraṃ labhantā paccekaṃ pañcapañcadhā vibhajiyanti,
analyzed: cattāro api maggaṭṭhā paṭhamajjhānika ādi vohāram labhantā paccekam pañca pañcadhā vibhajiyanti
translated: And they are each divided into five,

original: tasmā vīsati maggaṭṭhā honti. Tattha paṭhamajjhānādīsu yaṃ yaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajjitvā
analyzed: tasmā vīsati maggaṭṭhāḥ honti tattha paṭhamajjhāna ādīsu yam yam jhānam samāpajjitvā
translated: So they are the twenty who stand on the path. Herein, when he has attained any one of the first jhana, etc.,

original: tato vuṭṭhāya saṅkhāre sammasantassa vuṭṭhānagāminīvipassanā pavattā, taṃ pādakajjhānaṃ
analyzed: tatas vuṭṭhāya saṅkhāre sammasantassa vuṭṭhāna gāminī vipassanā pavattā tam pādakajjhānam
translated: So they are twenty in number. Herein, when a man has entered upon the first jhāna, etc., and has emerged from it, and then comprehends formations with insight, the insight leading to emergence that occurs is called the “threshold jhāna”

original: vuṭṭhānagāminivipassanāya padaṭṭhānabhāvato. Yaṃ yaṃ jhānaṃ sammasantassa sā pavattā,
analyzed: vuṭṭhāna gāmini vipassanāya padaṭṭhāna bhāvataḥ yam yam jhānam sammasantassa sā pavattā
translated: because it is the footing for the insight leading to emergence. That occurring in one who comprehends jhāna is called the “comprehended jhāna.”

original: taṃ sammasitajjhānaṃ. “Aho vata me paṭhamajjhānasadiso maggo pañcaṅgiko, dutiyajjhānādīsu
analyzed: tam sammasita jhānam aho vata me paṭhama jhāna sadisaḥ maggo pañcaṅgikaḥ dutiya jhāna ādīsu
translated: The “desire for the kind” is a man’s desire stated thus, “O that the path, which is the counterpart of the first jhāna, consisting of five factors, or of the second jhāna, etc.,

original: vā aññatarasadiso caturaṅgikādibhedo maggo bhaveyyā”ti evaṃ yogāvacarassa uppannajjhāsayo🔽puggalajjhāsayo nāma. Tattha yena paṭhamajjhānādīsu aññataraṃ jhānaṃ samāpajjitvā
analyzed: vā aññatara sadiso caturaṅgika ādi bhedaḥ maggo bhaveyya ati evam yogāvacarassa uppanna jjhāsayo  puggalajjhāsayaḥ nāma tattha yena paṭhamajjhāna ādīsu aññataram jhānam samāpajjitvā
translated: consisting of four factors, etc., might arise in me.” The “desire for the kind of person” is a man’s desire stated thus, “O that I might be a person of such and such a kind.”🔽Herein, when a man has entered upon any one of the jhānas beginning with the first, and has emerged from it, and has then comprehended miscellaneous formations, and the path has arisen in him, then that path is called the “first jhāna path,” etc.,

original: tato vuṭṭhāya pakiṇṇakasaṅkhāre sammasitvā maggo uppādito hoti, tassa so maggo paṭhamajjhānādi
analyzed: tatas vuṭṭhāya pakiṇṇaka saṅkhāre sammasitvā maggo uppāditaḥ hoti tassa so maggo paṭhamajjhāna ādi
translated: according as it is said, “The first jhāna has five factors, and the path that has arisen in dependence on the first jhāna is called ‘the first jhāna path’” , and so on.

original: taṃ taṃ pādakajjhānasadiso hoti. Sace pana vipassanāpādakaṃ kiñcijhānaṃ natthi, kevalaṃ🔽paṭhamajjhānādīsu aññataraṃ jhānaṃ sammasitvā maggo uppādito hoti, tassa so sammasitajjhānasadiso
analyzed: tam tam pādaka jjhāna sadisaḥ hoti sace pana vipassanā pādakam kiñci jhānam na atthi kevalam  paṭhamajjhāna ādīsu aññataram jhānam sammasitvā maggaḥ uppādito hoti tassa so sammasita jhāna sadiso
translated: It is like the basic jhāna. But if there is no jhāna that is the basis for insight, and the path has been generated by comprehending any one of the jhāna beginning with the first, then it is like the jhāna comprehended.

original: hoti. Yadā panayaṃ kiñci jhānaṃ samāpajjitvā tato aññaṃ sammasitvā maggo uppādito🔽hoti, tadā puggalajjhāsayavasena dvīsu aññatarasadiso hoti. Evaṃ samathayānikassa🔽puthujjanassa ariyānaṃ vā pādakajjhānasammasitajjhānapuggalajjhāsayavasena paṭhamajjhānādīnaṃ🔽aññatarajhānasadisassa maggaṅgikassa pavattanato puggalabhedavasena vīsati maggaṭṭhā
analyzed: hoti yadā pana yam kiñci jhānam samāpajjitvā tatas aññam sammasitvā maggaḥ uppādito  hoti tadā puggala jhāsaya vasena dvīsu aññatara sadisaḥ hoti evam samatha yānikassa  puthujjanassa ariyānam vā pādaka jjhāna sammasita jjhāna puggala jhā saya vasena paṭhama jhāna ādīnam  aññatara jhāna sadisassa maggaṅgikassa pavattanato puggala bheda vasena vīsati maggaṭṭhā
translated: But when the path has been generated by entering upon any jhāna and then comprehending another, then it is like one of the two according to whether it is a person’s habit to be in jhāna or not.🔽But when the path has been generated by entering upon any jhāna and then comprehending another, then it is like one of the two according to whether it is a person’s habit to be in jhāna or not.

original: puggalā honti, tathā phalaṭṭhāpi vīsatīti cattālīsaariyapuggalā honti. Aparampi sace
analyzed: puggalāḥ honti tathā vīsati iti cattālīsa ariya puggalāḥ honti aparam pi sace
translated: Thus, in the case of the ordinary man who is a vehicle for serenity, or of the noble person, there are twenty path-followers and twenty fruit-attainers, that is, forty kinds of noble persons, because of the occurrence of the path consisting of the factors of the first jhāna, etc., which is like one of the basic jhāna, the jhāna comprehended, or the jhāna that is a person’s habit, according to the kind of vehicle.

original: pana puggalassa tathā vidho ajjhāsayo natthi, anulomavasena heṭṭhimaheṭṭhimajhānato
analyzed: pana puggalassa tathā vidhaḥ ajjhāsayaḥ natthi anuloma vasena heṭṭhima heṭṭhima jhānato
translated: Moreover, if a person has no such habit, and the path has been generated by comprehending the jhāna next below the one he has entered upon in forward order, then it is like the jhāna comprehended.

original: vuṭṭhāya uparūparijhānadhamme sammasitvā uppāditamaggo pādakajjhānamanapekkhitvā🔽sammasitajjhānasadiso hoti. Paṭilomavasena uparūparijhānato vuṭṭhāya heṭṭhimaheṭṭhimajhānadhamme
analyzed: vuṭṭhāya upari upari jhāna dhamme sammasitvā uppādita maggaḥ pādaka jhānam an apekkhitvā  sammasita jhāna sadisaḥ hoti paṭiloma vasena uparu upari jhānataḥ vuṭṭhāya heṭṭhima heṭṭhima jhāna dhamme
translated: and having done so, the path that is generated is like the basic jhāna, regardless of the jhāna that is resolved upon.

original: sammasitvā uppāditamaggo sammasitajjhānamanapekkhitvā pādakajjhānasadiso hoti, heṭṭhimaheṭṭhimajhānato
analyzed: sammasitvā uppādita maggaḥ sammasita jhānam an apekkhitvā pādaka jhāna sadisaḥ hoti heṭṭhima heṭṭhima jhānato
translated: And having emerged from the higher and higher kinds of reviewing in the reverse order, and having resolved upon the lower and lower kinds of jhāna, and having done so, the path that is generated is like the jhāna that is resolved upon, regardless of the reviewing jhāna.🔽For the higher and higher kinds of reviewing are stronger than the lower and lower kinds of reviewing.

original: hi uparūparijhānaṃ balavataranti, aṭṭhasatampi purisapuggalāti tattha ekabījī, kolaṃkolo,
analyzed: hi upara upari jhānam balavataranti aṭṭha satam pi purisa puggalā ti tattha eka bījī kolaṃkolo
translated: There are eight hundred and forty-four kinds of men, namely, the one of quick understanding, the one of medium …🔽the one of sluggish understanding, who are respectively of the type that attains Nibbāna in the interval, of the type that attains Nibbāna upon landing, of the type that attains Nibbāna without conduct, of the type that attains Nibbāna with conduct, of the type that goes upstream to the Pure Abodes, and of the type that goes upstream to the immaterial world, and who are respectively of the type that attains Nibbāna in the fine-material sphere, of the type that attains Nibbāna in the immaterial sphere, and of the type that is destined for the highest.🔽There are three kinds of stream-enterers who have attained the fruit in the fine-material and immaterial kinds of becoming.

original: sattakkhattuparamoti tayo sotāpannā. Kāmarūpārūpabhavesu adhigataphalā tayo sakadāgāminoti🔽te sabbepi dukkhapaṭipadā dandhābhiññaṃ, dukkhapaṭipadā khippābhiññaṃ, sukhāpaṭipadā
analyzed: tayo sā utāpannā kāmarūpa arūpa bhavesu adhigata phalā tayo sakadāgāmino ti  te sabbe pi dukkha paṭipadā dandha abhiññam dukkha paṭipadā khippa abhiññam sukha apaṭipadā
translated: There are three kinds of once-returners who have attained the fruit in the fine-material and immaterial kinds of becoming.

original: dandhābhiññaṃ, sukhāpaṭipadā khippābhiññanti catunnaṃ paṭipadānaṃ vasena catuvīsati,
analyzed: dandha abhiññam sukhā paṭipadā khippā abhiññanti catunnam paṭipadānam vasena catuvīsati
translated: All these are of twenty-four kinds according to the four ways: as of painful progress and sluggish understanding, painful progress and quick understanding, pleasant progress and sluggish understanding, and pleasant progress and quick understanding.

original: antarāparinibbāyī, upahaccapari nibbāyī, sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyī, asaṅkhāraparinibbāyī,
analyzed: antarā parinibbāyī upahacca pari nibbāyī sa saṅkhāra parinibbāyī asaṅkhāra parinibbāyī
translated: One who attains Nibbāna early, one who attains Nibbāna after a while, one who attains Nibbāna with effort, one who attains Nibbāna without effort,

original: uddhaṃsoto akaniṭṭhagāmīti avihāsu pañca anāmigāno, tathā atappāsudassāsudassīsupi🔽pañca. Akaniṭṭhesu pana uddhaṃsotavajjā antarāparinibbāyī, upahaccaparinibbāyī, sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyī,
analyzed: a kaniṭṭha gāmī iti a vihāsu pañca tathā  pañca akaniṭṭhesu pana uddhaṃsa utavajjāḥ antarā parinibbāyī upahacca parinibbāyī sa saṅkhāra parinibbāyī
translated: one who goes upstream to the highest gods. So there are five in the Aviha realm, and likewise five in the Atappa realm, five in the Sudassa realm, and five in the Sudassī realm.🔽But in the Akaniṭṭha realm there are four, that is to say, one who attains Nibbāna early, one who attains Nibbāna after a while, one who attains Nibbāna with effort, and one who attains Nibbāna without effort, omitting the one who goes upstream.

original: asaṅkhāraparibbāyīti cattāroti catuvīsati anāgāmino. Sukkhavipassako, samathayānikoti
analyzed: asaṅkhāra paribbāyī iti cattāraḥ ti catuvīsati anāgāminaḥ sukkha vipassako samatha yāniko ti
translated: And there are two kinds of Arahants, that is to say, one who attains Nibbāna early and one who attains Nibbāna after a while. So there are fifty-four in all.

original: dve arahanto, cattāro maggaṭṭhāti catupaññāsa te sabbepi saddhādhurapaññādhurānaṃvasena
analyzed: dve arahantaḥ cattāraḥ maggaṭṭhā ti catupaññāsa te sabbe pi saddhādhura paññādhurānaṃ vasena
translated: All these are doubled by making the distinction of those with faith as their ground and those with understanding as their ground.🔽So there are one hundred and eight Noble Persons.🔽All these Noble Persons, who are referred to in detail as “one hundred and eight,”

original: dveguṇe hutvā aṭṭhasataṃ ariyapuggalā honti. Te sabbepi “aṭṭhasataṃ vā”ti vitthāravasena
analyzed: dveguṇe hutvā aṭṭhasatam ariya puggalāḥ honti te sabbe pi aṭṭhasatam vāti vitthāra vasena
translated: are summarized as two, that is to say,

original: uddiṭṭhā ariyapuggalā te saṅkhepato yugavasena sotāpatti maggaṭṭho phalaṭṭhoti ekaṃ
analyzed: uddiṭṭhā ariya puggalā te saṅkhepataḥ yuga vasena sotāpatti magga ṭṭho phala ṭṭho ti ekam
translated: one who is on the path to the fruit of Stream Entry, and one who is on the path to the fruit of Once Return.

original: yugantyādinā cattārova honti. Tenevāha ratanaparitte “ye puggalā aṭṭhasataṃ pasatthā,
analyzed: yuga nti ādinā cattāraḥ iva honti tena iva āha ratana paritte ye puggalāḥ aṭṭhasatam pasatthā
translated: and so there are four in each pair. Hence it is said in the Ratana-Paritta: “The persons who are praised as eighty thousand,

original: cattāri etāni yugāni hontī”ti ayaṃ pabhedomaggaṭṭhaphalaṭṭhesu missakavasena labbhati🔽jhānikavipassakapabhedo pana phalaṭṭheyeva labbhati maggassa ekacittakkhatikattā
analyzed: cattāri etāni yugāni honti iti ayam pabhedo maggaṭṭha phalaṭṭhesu missaka vasena labbhati  jhānika vipassaka pabhedaḥ pana phala ṭṭheyā iva labbhati maggassa eka citta kkhatika ttā
translated: These are the four pairs.” This classification is found in those who are established in fruition and in those who are established in the path.🔽But the classification of those who are established in fruition as “those who obtain by means of the jhānas” and “those who obtain by means of insight” is found only in those who are established in fruition, not in those who are established in the path, because the path is of one moment only.

original: maggaṭṭhesu na labbhati. Tattha sotāpattiphalaṭṭho jhānikasukkhavipassakavasena duvidho.🔽Tesu jhāniko puggalo tasmiṃ bhave arahattappatto parinibbāyati. Appatto brahmalokagato🔽hoti, so jhāniko nāma. Mūlaṭīkāyaṃ pana nikantiyā sati puthujjanādayo yathāladdhajjhānassa
analyzed: magga ṭṭhesu na labbhati tattha sotāpatti phala ṭṭhaḥ jhānika sukkha vipassaka vasena duvidhaḥ  tesu jhānikaḥ puggalo tasmim bhave arahatta patto parinibbāyati appattaḥ brahma loka gato  hoti saḥ jhānikaḥ nāma mūlaṭīkā ayam pana nikantiyā sati puthujjana ādayaḥ yathā laddha jhānassa
translated: Herein, the establishment in the fruition of stream-entry is twofold as “one who obtains by means of the jhānas” and “one who obtains by means of insight.”

original: bhūmibhūte suddhāvāsavajjite yattha katthaci nibbattanti tathā kāmabhavepi kāmāvacarakammabalena
analyzed: bhūmi bhūte suddhāvāsa vajjite yattha katthaci nibbattanti tathā kāma bhave pi kāmāvacara kamma balena
translated: Herein, one who obtains by means of the jhānas reaches Arahantship in that existence. One who does not reach it goes to the Brahmā-world and becomes what is called a “jhānika.” But in the Mula-Tika it is said that “when there is attachment, ordinary men, etc., are reborn in any one of the pure abodes that are the plane of the jhāna they have obtained, whether in the fine-material or immaterial kinds of becoming.

original: “ijjhati hi bhikkhave sīlavato cetopaṇidhi visuddhattā”ti vuttaṃ. Anāgāmino pana
analyzed: ijjhati hi bhikkhave sīlavataḥ cetopaṇidhi visuddha ttā ti vuttam anāgāminaḥ pana
translated: For it is said: ‘The heart’s wish of one who is virtuous succeeds, bhikkhus, because of his purity’ . But non-returners

original: kāmarāgassa sabbaso pahīnattā kāmabhavesu nikantiṃ na uppādentīti kāmalokavajjite
analyzed: kāma rāgassa sabbaso pahīna ttā kāma bhavesu nikantim na uppādenti iti kāma loka vajjite
translated: and because of the complete abandoning of lust for sensual desires, they do not arouse attachment to the sensual-desire becoming.

original: yathāladdhassa bhūmi bhūte yattha katthaci nibbattantī’ti vuttaṃ tathā hi anāgāmisseva🔽kāmabhave nikantiyā pahīnattā sotāpannasakadāgāmīnampi nikantiyā sati kāmabhave kāmāvacarakammabalena
analyzed: yathā laddhassa bhūmi bhūte yattha katthaci nibbattanti iti vuttam tathā hi anāgāmissa eva  kāma bhave nikantiyā pahīna ttā sotāpanna sakadāgāmīnam pi nikantiyā sati kāma bhave kāmāvacara kamma balena
translated: “They are not reborn in any place whatsoever that has come to be” is said.

original: uppattibhāvo avāritova hotīti viññāyati tasmā “appatte brahmalokagato hoti, so jhāniko
analyzed: uppatti bhāvaḥ a vāritaḥ iva hoti iti viññāyati tasmai appatte brahma loka gataḥ hoti so jhāniko
translated: For it is because of the non-arising of attachment to the sensual-desire becoming in the non-returners that it is known that the arising of the non-returners in the sensual-desire becoming by the power of kamma belonging to the sensual-desire becoming is blocked even though they have not yet reached the Brahmā-world.

original: nāmāti idaṃ yebhuyyavasena vutta”nti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Sukkhavipassako pana tividho ekabījī,
analyzed: nāma āti idam yebhuyya vasena vuttanti daṭṭhabbam sukkha vipassakaḥ pana tividhaḥ eka bījī
translated: So it should be regarded as said in the sense of the majority.

original: kolaṃkolo, sattakkhattuparamoti. Tattha eko manussaloke vā hotu chadevaloke vā, ekapaṭisandhiko🔽hutvā arahattaṃ patvā parinibbāyati, ayaṃ ekabījī nāma eko manussaloke ekā paṭisandhi
analyzed: kolaṃkolo satta kkhattu paramaḥ ti tattha ekaḥ manussa loke vā hotu cha deva loke vā eka paṭisandhiko 🔽hutvā arahattam patvā parinibbāyati ayam ekabījī nāma ekaḥ manussa loke ekā paṭisandhi
translated: But the bare-insight worker is of three kinds: the one-seeder, the clan-to-clan, and the seven-at-most.

original: devaloke ekāti dvepaṭisandhiko vā, evaṃ ticatupañcachaparamo hutvā arahattaṃ patvā🔽parinibbāyati, ayaṃ kolaṃkolo nāma. Eko manussaloke sotāpanno hutvā devaloke ekā🔽paṭisandhi tato punāgantvā manussaloke ekāti evaṃ manussadevalokamissakavasena tattha🔽cattāri idha tīṇityādinā tattha cha, idha ekoti yāva sattapaṭisandhiko hutvā parinibbāyati,
analyzed: deva loke dvi paṭisandhikaḥ vai evam ti catu pañca cha paramaḥ hutvā arahattam patvā  parinibbāyati ayam kolaṃkolaḥ nāma ekaḥ manussa loke sotāpannaḥ hutvā deva loke ekā  tatas puna āgantvā manussa loke ekā ati evam manussa deva loka missaka vasena tattha  cattāri idha tīṇi ityādinā tattha cha idha ekaḥ iti yāva satta paṭisandhikaḥ hutvā parinibbāyati
translated: or in the divine world he is one who has two rebirths, and so on up to one who has seven rebirths, and then he reaches Arahantship and attains Nibbāna. This is called the “cluster-fruit type.” One who is a stream-enterer in the human world and has one rebirth in the divine world, and then comes back again to the human world, and so on, in this way combining the human and divine worlds,🔽and in this way he attains Nibbāna after having seven rebirths,🔽

original: ayaṃ sattakkhattuparamo nāma. Kevalaṃ pana manussaloke yeva satta devalokeyeva vā🔽sattāti evaṃ amisso hutvā paṭisandhiko gahetabbo apare pana “ito satta, tato satta🔽saṃsāre vicarantī”ti vuttattā manussalokasattapaṭisandhidevaloka sattapaṭisandhivasena🔽sattakkhattuparamaṃ vadanti. Taṃ ayuttaṃ kasmā “kiñcāpi te honti bhusaṃpamattā, na
analyzed: ayam satta kkhattu paramaḥ nāma kevalam pana manussa loke yā iva satta deva loke yā iva vā 🔽satta ati evam amissaḥ hutvā paṭisandhikaḥ gahetabbo apare pana itas satta tatas satta 🔽saṃsāre vicaranti iti vutta ttā manussa loka satta paṭisandhi deva loka satta paṭisandhi vasena 🔽satta kkhattu paramam vadanti tam ayuttam kasmā kiñca api te honti na
